column17: On 8 October 2020, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting government security forces detonated in Xaawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 8 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants gained control of Ballo village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) after government security forces force to withdraw from the area.
On 8 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants gained control over Daniga village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), after government security forces were forced to withdraw from the area.
On 8 October 2020, government security forces in an operation clashed with Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Bariirre town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Ten militants were killed.
On 8 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants gained control of Baasra village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) after government security forces were forced to withdraw from the area.

On 8 October 2020, Kenya defense forces conducted an airstrike against civilians pastoralists in Baliga Harakoobe,Yaaqle, Qabri-xaaji and Baliga Dhadhaable near Belet Xaawo town (Belet Xaawo, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 8 October 2020, Kenya defense forces conducted an airstrike targetting Al Shabaab militants in Dadabil village (Belet Xaawo, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 9 October 2020, unknown gunmen threw a hand grenade at a tea shop where civilians were present near Argo junction in Farjano village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Three people were injured.
On 9 October 2020, local residents demonstrated against increased taxes by the Galmudug administration in Hobyo town (Hobyo, Mudug). [size=no report]
On 9 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade targeting a deputy district officer in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). One person was injured in the explosion.

On 9 October 2020, local residents demonstrated in Badhan town (Laasqoray, Sanaag). The protesters demanded the minister of interior of Puntland state to stop interfering in the selection of electoral delegates. [size=no report]

On 9 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a government security forces (SNA) convoy on Baidoa-Daynunaay main road at Buunda Midow village (Baydhaba, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 10 October 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a man while he was inside a mosque in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 10 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against AMISOM Ugandan forces base in Baraawe town (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 10 October 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting an AMISOM Uganda convoy detonated between Maxaas and Shalaambood village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 10 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a government soldier at Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 11 October 2020, over fifty students protested on the main road leading to the Ministry of Education office in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal), after their school was closed by the ministry. [size=over fifty]
On 11 October 2020, two Habar Gedir sub clan militias clashed in the vicinity of Xananbuuro village (Dhuusamarreeb, Gedo). Two people were killed and three others were injured.
On 11 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer collecting tax in the main market at Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir).
On 11 October 2020, over a hundred locals staged a peaceful protest demanding equal representation for the Hirshabelle administration in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). [size=over a hundred]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 11 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM forward operation base in the vicinity of Baraawe town (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 12 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against a government security forces base in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 12 October 2020, unidentified gunmen clashed with Puntland police forces in Burtinle town (Burtinle, Nugaal). One person was killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 12 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortar rounds at the AMISOM ENDF base in Qansax Dheere village (Qansax Dheere, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 12 October 2020, local businessmen protested over the increased tax by the Galmudug administration in Cadaado town (Cadaado, Galgaduud). [size=no report]
On 13 October 2020, local residents protested in the streets of Ceerigaabo town (Caarigaabo, Sanaag), demanding justice for a woman who had been raped and killed. [size=no report]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 13 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM UDF convoy between Golwey and Danow village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 13 October 2020, a senior military official was shot and killed by a military officer in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). The motive is unknown.
On 13 October 2020, unidentified gunmen attacked government security forces (military) in Towfiq village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). One soldier was killed in the clash.
On 13 October 2020, unknown gunmen attacked a minibus travelling from Mogadishu to Jowhar in Garsaalley village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two civilians were killed.

On 13 October 2020, an Abgal clan militia clashed with a Hawadle clan militia in Shiirkaneeco village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Two people were killed. The clash was prompted by the Hirshabelle election.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 13 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland security forces base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 13 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland security forces convoy travelling from Bula Gaduud to Kismayo in Yontoy Yarey village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column9: Former Government of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Administration
column17: On 13 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an elder at Tusbaxle village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The elder was a former electoral delegate who participated in 2016 parliamentary elections in Jubaland state.

On 13 October 2020, two government security forces (military and police) clashed in Xaawo Naasir village of Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The motive behind the clashes was disputes over public land. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 14 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a Horseed checkpoint manned by government forces for revenue tax collection in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 14 October 2020, a government soldier shot and killed a tuktuk driver over an unknown dispute at Ex-Control Afgoye in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir).
On 14 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with government security forces (SNA) at a foot patrol checkpoint in the vicinity of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Two soldiers were killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 14 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Jubaland security force and AMISOM KDF forward operation base in Tabta village (Afmadow, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 14 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortar rounds targeting the residence of the chief of Hosingow village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column17: On 14 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed an AMISOM UDF convoy between Shalambood and Bula Mareer village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 15 October 2020, local residents protested along Mogadishu-Afgooye roads over closed roads in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). They demanded all closed roads to be opened. [size=no report]
On 15 October 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeting a tuktuk transporting passengers exploded in Miir-Taqwo village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two people were killed.

On 15 October 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting government security forces (Gorgor) exploded between Mogadishu and Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 15 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted a probing attack targeting a Jubaland security forces checkpoint at Yontoy Yarey village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 16 October 2020, an IED by unknown group exploded in front of Kaah Mosque in Garsoor village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The IED was planted beneath the driver seat of a car owned by the Puntland district attorney for Galkayo. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 16 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed returning government security forces (SNA) between Buurweyne and Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 16 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against an AMISOM KDF troops forward operation base in the vicinity of Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 16 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a probing attack targeting government military forces (SNA) forces position in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 16 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM defensive base at Arbacow settlement near Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 17 October 2020, a Sacad sub-clan militia shot and killed two civilian men from Leelkayse clan in Saxquran village (Hobyo, Mudug). The incident was related to clan revenge.
On 17 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack against a government security forces base (SNA) in Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo). Two soldiers were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 17 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM defensive base at Arbacow settlement near Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). This is the second time Al Shabaab militants attacked Arbacow base. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 18 October 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED exploded, targeting a government security forces (SNAF) convoy which was travelling on the road between Ceel Cade and Ceel Baraf village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). At least four soldiers were killed.

On 18 October 2020, four children were injured after an unexploded explosive device they were playing detonated in the vicinity of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 18 October 2020, a remote controlled IED by an unknown group targeted a government security forces (SNA) convoy, exploding near Manyafulka village (Baydhaba, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 19 October 2020, a government soldier shot and killed a tuk tuk driver near Mogadishu mall in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). The soldier was manning an entrance checkpoint at the mall.
On 19 October 2020, unknown gunmen abducted a young girl from her home at Xafada Shanaad village in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir).

On 19 October 2020, over a hundred local residents stage a protest when a young girl was raped by her quran teacher in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). They demanded justice. [size=over hundred]

On 19 October 2020, government security forces attacked an Al Shabaab checkpoint in Nuurgare village near Bariirre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). At least 18 militants were killed and several others injured.
On 19 October 2020, government security forces attacked an Al Shabaab checkpoint in Buur Weyn village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Eleven militants were killed in the operation.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 19 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at an AMISOM ENDF base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). AMISOM ENDF troops fired back at the militants. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 19 October 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeted government security forces (SNA), exploding in the vicinity of Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 19 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against an AMISOM KDF troops base in Hosingow town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 20 October 2020, government security forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Lagu mitiri village near Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 20 October 2020, a remote controlled IED by unknown group targeted an AMISOM Burundi troops convoy coming from Jowhar in Buurane village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 20 October 2020, over 20 journalist staged a peaceful protest in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir), demanding the release of their fellow reporter who was detained by the NISA. [size=over 20]

On 20 October 2020, an Al Shabaab landmine targeted a government top officials convoy detonated near CID headquarters along KM4 road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Two people were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 20 October 2020, AMISOM Burundi troops convoy shot and killed a civilian women in the vicinity of Mahadaay village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 21 October 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a peaceful protest on the main road of Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan). The protesters were demanding a fair share of seats between clans and sub clan in the HirShabelle state election. [size=over a hundred]

On 21 October 2020, government security forces (SNA) clashed with a Habar Gedir clan militia in the outskirts of Cadaado town (Cadaado, Galgaduud). The motive of the clash is unknown. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 21 October 2020, two government security forces (SNA) units clashed in a checkpoint in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir). One person was killed.
On 21 October 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a senior official in Puntland military court near his house in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal).
On 21 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against a government security forces base in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 21 October 2020, government security forces (SNA, Danab) clashed with an Al Shabaab militants convoy in the vicinity of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). At least 19 militants were killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 21 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with an AMISOM ENDF convoy passing in the vicinity of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). Al Shabaab allegedly killed at least six soldiers.
On 21 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a government soldier on foot patrol in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir).
On 21 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man who was electoral delegate in the ongoing election in Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 22 October 2020, an IED by unknown gunmen targeting civilians exploded at a teashop in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). Several people were injured.

On 22 October 2020, clan militias from Abgal and Hawadle clans clashed in Bilcile village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan), due to the clan disputes for the leadership of HirShabelle state. One person was killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 22 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland security forces convoy travelling between Abdale Birrole and Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two soldiers were killed.
On 22 October 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED targeting government security forces exploded in the vicinity of Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 22 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a government police forces (SWSPF) checkpoint in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). 2 soldiers were killed.
On 22 October 2020, government security forces (SNA) and Kenya defense forces clashed in the vicinity of Belet Xaawo town (Belet Xaawo, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 23 October 2020, government security forces took control of Lebi Duule village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud) from Al Shabaab militants who had controlled the village for the last ten years. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 23 October 2020, an IED by unknown group exploded and killed four children in Bangeele village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud). The children were playing with device before it exploded.
On 23 October 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed two farmers in Baasra village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The gunmen also injured three others.

On 23 October 2020, Government security forces siezed a vehicle full of explosives heading to Baidoa at a checkpoint in the vicinity of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 24 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortar rounds at a AMISOM Djibouti base at Ugaas Nuure airport in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 24 October 2020, government security forces (Danab) clashed with Al Shabaab militants in an operation conducted between Balcad and Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). One senior Al Shabaab militant was killed.
On 24 October 2020, two suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a police officer in teashop at Jumhuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). One militant was killed.
On 24 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian when he was taking wudhu at Kurmad village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir).
A man suspected of raping a three-year-old girl was attacked and killed by a mob near King Williams Town the day after Christmas.
A mob stoned to death a Limpopo priest they believed had ""bewitched"" his young relative into committing suicide. The attack occurred on Rakoma village just outside Tzaneen.
Residents of an informal settlement protest their forced removal from the area.
Shebeen owners protest the forced closure of their pubs.
A vigilante mob kills a man after rumours he and recently ""hanged a man.""
Parents protest over a lack of a high school in their area.
Residents lock a politician in a room in protest of a proposed housing development.
Youths protest over a lack of government grants potentially awarded to them.
Residents protest, demanding speed humps along a road after a spate of several auto accidents.
Service delivery protesters block roads and burn tyres during mid-morning.
Residents of Olievenhoutbosch, Midrand, protested outside the Kempton Park Magistrates Court against a company operating a toxic waste incinerator in their area.
Pupils break their schools windows and destroy other property in a protest over the institutions quality of food.
Parents hold a school official hostage in Port Elizabeth during a protest over a school staff shortage.
Taxi drivers block roads outside of Ka-Mapapila in protest of their poor state.
Parents of students blocked the road leading to the entrance of their school, protest for the removal of its principal on grounds of poor leadership.
Students of Mangosuthu University protest fees.
Traffic is blocked during a protest against police after a high-profile crime remained unsolved.
Protesters gather outside the Egyptian embassy in Pretoria to show support for the anti-Mubarak uprisings in Cairo.

Members of the community in Giyani took the law into their own hands by setting alight a house belonging to a man suspected of killing people for muthi purposes. During the incident, two occupants are assaulted by the mob.
""Backyarders"" in Nyanga block roads and light fires in protest over housing.
Students of University of KwaZulu-Natal violently protest over financial aid accommodation over two days. On the second at police implemented tear-gas against the students.
Durban University of Technology students protest over school funding over two consecutive days.
Durban University of Technology students protest over school funding over two consecutive days.
Residents violently protest following a spate of rape violence in the area. Several of the protesters were arrested.
A 23-year-old man, suspected of stealing school property, was beaten to death by a mob.

More than 200 ANC members in Vereeniging stormed into their regional offices to demand that their region be disbanded over it recommendation of candidates. Police had to intervene to defuse the situation.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Two truck drivers have been slightly injured and 10 trucks damaged in Port Elizabeth over for days of protests. Violence reported on 16/02. Police involvement on the last two days of the protest.
ANC members protest at heir selection a party headquarters in Pietermaritzburg over their selection of candidates.
Police fire rubber bullets and tear gas at tire burning protesters demanding better housing and municipal services. Three killed after a police station is set afire.
A woman and a child drown trying to escape police fire during a municipal service and housing protest. This event occurred in an un incorporated town 300km southwest of Johannesburg known as Boipelo.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Violent labour union protest in Olifantsfontein.
Right2Know campaigners protest at parliament over a proposed bill.
Municipal service protesters clash with police. No report of injury or death. The protest lasts over the course of three days.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Striking, protesting SATAWU members assault non-striking workers at Kempton Park.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Two truck drivers have been slightly injured and 10 trucks damaged in Port Elizabeth over for days of protests. Violence reported on 16/02. Police involvement on the last two days of the protest.
An IFP councilor is believed to be assassinated after a defection from the National Freedom Party. He was shot while travelling in his car.
Municipal service protesters clash with police. No report of injury or death. The protest lasts over the course of three days.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Two truck drivers have been slightly injured and 10 trucks damaged in Port Elizabeth over for days of protests. Violence reported on 16/02. Police involvement on the last two days of the protest.
Municipal service protesters clash with police. No report of injury or death. The protest lasts over the course of three days.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Two truck drivers have been slightly injured and 10 trucks damaged in Port Elizabeth over for days of protests. Violence reported on 16/02 only. Police involvement on the last two days of the protest.
Students parents protest, threaten to burn tyres in action against a teacher shortage in Cederberg.
Johannesburg residents protested over council billing complaints outside the cities customer service centre in Braamfontein. The protest was led by the Democratic Alliance.
A vigilante group attacks a suspected criminal, no fatality.
Students of University of KwaZulu-Natal violently protest over financial aid accommodation over two days. On the second at police implemented tear-gas against the students.
SASCO students of CPUT protest funding from a financial aid scheme.
Sex workers protest for health care services.
Protest against gender-based violence in Port Elizabeth.
Students protest for the return of their recently released principal.
Protesters call for a police chief to step down from his position over improper conduct.
Students of the University of Limpopos Medunsa campus protest over the suspension of several colleges.
A man accused of housebreaking is tortured to death by locals.
About 1 000 people marched to Parliament in Cape Town to hand over a petition urging the passing of the Prevention and Combating of Trafficking in Persons Bill.
Residents of the Zandspruit shanty town protest the ruling party ANC over squalor conditions. Police respond with rubber bullets after they are pelted with stones.
ANC supporters protests their party leadership over their selection of candidates.
Several Umlazi schools protest a spate of crime in their area.
Pubils from two Limpopo primary schools toyi-toyied outside the Naphuno magistrates court in Tzaneen in protest against a case of child abuse and rape.
Violent ANC protesters target ANC offices in Cape Town after many of their preferred candidates were left off an election list. Some property was reported destroyed.
On 22 March 2011, demonstors burnt and looted shops belonging to foreign nationals in Ficksburg, over a local election-related issue. [size=no report]

column7: POPCRU: Police, Prisons and Civil Rights Union
column17: Members of the Police and Prisons Civil Rights Union (Popcru) demonstrated at the Empangeni medium security prison and the maximum security Qalakabusha prison just outside the town on 23/02 and 24/02.The warders were protesting a new shift system.

column7: POPCRU: Police, Prisons and Civil Rights Union
column17: Members of the Police and Prisons Civil Rights Union (Popcru) demonstrated at the Empangeni medium security prison and the maximum security Qalakabusha prison just outside the town on 23/02 and 24/02.The warders were protesting a new shift system.
Students of University of KwaZulu-Natal over the alleged lack of financial aid, adequate security and wireless internet access. There was a large police presence at the protest.
Anti-illicit drug protest in Manenberg. Many of the protesters confronted and intimidated suspected dealers in the area. Date unknown - source dated 24/03.
Service delivery protest in Ladysmith. By accident, a truck hit the group, killing four.
Police and service delivery protesters clash in Johannesburg.
Healthcare workers protest the non-payment of stipends.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: Robben Island museum staff union protests for the removal of the acting human resource manager.
An environmental group protests at parliament over the fracking practice.
Residents of a squatter camp protest against the imposition of an ANC councillor. Police use tear gas elements to disperse the group.
Police react to violent ANC protesters over the parties selection of a candidate. Tear gas and rubber bullets used by police.
Service delivery protests ""around Limpopo"" on 07/04.
A mob of vigilantes attack a man who they suspect killed a woman. Police intervene and rescue the man, arrest 49 of the vigilantes.
Four days (09/04 - 12/04) of violent service delivery protests in Rosdale.
Four days (09/04 - 12/04) of violent service delivery protests in Rosdale.
Four days (09/04 - 12/04) of violent service delivery protests in Rosdale.
Mangosuthu University students protest between 11/04 and 15/04 over a management position of squatters on campus. The protest was violent on 14/04.
Mangosuthu University students protest between 11/04 and 15/04 over a management position of squatters on campus. The protest was violent on 14/04.

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: Labor Unions block a SA/Swazi border crossing in an effort to paralyze the Swazi economy.
Four days (09/04 - 12/04) of violent service delivery protests in Rosdale.
Two municipal buildings were set alight by rioters after the killing of a man allegedly by the police.
Mangosuthu University students protest between 11/04 and 15/04 over a management position of squatters on campus. The protest was violent on 14/04.

A demonstrator is restrained and killed by police during a service delivery protest after a confrontation with riot police. There are no reports of violence during the protest or on the part of the deceased.
Mangosuthu University students protest between 11/04 and 15/04 over a management position of squatters on campus. The protest was violent on 14/04.
Violent protests against police following the death of a man.
Mangosuthu University students protest between 11/04 and 15/04 over a management position of squatters on campus. The protest was violent on 14/04.
Cape Flats residents barricade public roads after their illegal electric connections were cut off.
Service delivery protesters block a road a burn tyres.
ANC protesters destroyed several of their candidates election material of a inter-party disagreement in Delft.
Khayelitsha residents march to demand better sanitation.
Protesters gather at the Japanese embassy in a anti-nuclear protest.
Protesters gather at the parliament building to calk for the release of a South African photographer held captive in Libya.
Students violently protest a ban on political party activities at school. Several arrests reported.
Employees of a Japanese tyre company protest outside the Japanese Embassy in Groenkloof over an impasse with company management.
Violent housing protesters are dispersed by police, sixteen arrested.
A group of fishermen protest a fishing ban along Durban beaches.
Khayelitsha residents march to demand better sanitation.
Protest in Zandspruit over an ANC candidate.
University of Cape Town students protest against the death of a colleague.
Power plant workers protest over the hiring foreign labour. The protest caused operation of the plant to close.

column9: ANC: African National Congress; Women (South Africa)
column17: An ANC candidate is attack by racists who try to break her arm.
Contract workers protest during the construction of a power plant against the hiring of foreign workers. The protest was characterised as violent.
500 residents of Vastrap protested for housing in front of Booysen Park High School.
Parents of primary school students protest against a lack of teachers at the institution.
An ANC protest disrupts election broadcast.
A group protests recent occurrences of ""corrective rape.""
A group protests a municipal administrator who failed to authorize development of golf estate.
A group of squatters protest, police forcibly remove them several days layer.
Parents shut down a Bloemendal school over teacher pay. A similar protest occurred in Nelson Mandela Bay.
Angry protesters burn homes in protest of a man who was receiving treatment at a hospital after he had shot and killed two girls. Four police officers were injured in the fracas.
Students at two Cape Peninsula University of Technology locations protest fees.
Parents protest at a school over the non-payment of substitute teachers.
Students at two Cape Peninsula University of Technology locations protest fees.
Students of Cape Peninsula University of Technology protest against fees.
Police clash with protesting squatters when they attempt to forcibly remove them.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Workers of the SAMWU protest for the removal of an anti-labor public official. Is dispersed without the aid of police.
Animal rights activists protest a man accused of violence against animals.
Seven arrested for violence during a ANC election result protest.
Church groups protest against pornography in Johannesburg and Cape Town.
Church groups protest against pornography in Johannesburg and Cape Town.
ANC members violently protest the result on an election.
Sixteen arrested in an ANC protest against the result of an election.
ANC members protest the result on an election for a second consecutive day.
ANC members violently protest the result on an election.

One man was beaten to death and nine others were injured when a riotous mob in Mecklenburg, Limpopo, attacked a vehicle transporting mine employees. The rioters were protesting against the mining company for employing non-locals.
Vigilantes stone a man over suspected theft. The man survived, saved by police.
A group protested outside Motherwell Magistrates Court over the arrest of six who assembled illegal structures.
ANC members protest the election of a local politician.
People gather to protest poor police performance of solving violent crimes. Two are shot and killed, allegedly by police. Others injured.
Members of the ANC stage sit-ins over the inauguration of the local mayor.
A group protests backyard dweller evictions outside the Western Cape High Court building.
Residents protest against the high presence of Somali shopkeepers in Ramaphosa settlement, Johannesburg.
A group of armed men kill a Somali journalist. It is unclear if the motive for violence was a robbery or other.
ANC protesters, unhappy with their parties choice for a municipal mayoral candidate, clash with police. Five arrested, one wounded.
ANC protesters, unhappy with their parties choice for a municipal mayoral candidate, clash with police. Five arrested, one wounded.
Residents of a retirement village protest poor living conditions.
People gather to violently protest a taxi fare increase. Two reported deaths.
People gather to violently protest a taxi fare increase for the second day. Two reported deaths.
Residents of Noordgesig protest persistent blackouts.
Residents of Noordgesig protest a lack of electricity for a second day.
Residents of Noordgesig protest for three days after a period without electricity. On the third day many of the residents set tyre fires. Reports of police tear-gas.
An education union in Pretoria protests their management.

ANC members, angered over the nomination of a ward councillor at Georgetown, near Edendale in Pietermaritzburg, set tyres alight and blockaded the main road, forcing police to fire stun grenades to disperse the angry mob, which also stoned police vehicles.

column7: SAMA: South African Medical Association; Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: Doctors belonging to SAMA protest outside their hospital calling for increased security following the murder of a colleague by a patient.
Protesters at an ANC headquarters in Nelson Mandela Bay trespass and are met with police resistance.
Residents violently protest against an ANC politician in Danielskuil, throwing stones at passing cars and destroying other property.
Residents block a road in protest of not being involved in a local employment project.
Commuters set four Putco buses alight over an increase on fees.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a man for allegedly stealing a cell phone. His eyes were gouged out, his tongue was cut off, his throat slit, and genitals chopped off during the attack.
Residents protest violently over alleged housing fraud. Police respond with tear gas. Eighteen arrested.
Greenpeace blocks a road in front of Eskom headquarters in protest of their planned construction of a oil plant.
Service delivery protests turn violent in Zandspruit.
People gather near judicial buildings to protest the slow speed of a sexual assault case.
Service delivery protest turns violent in Zandspruit for second consecutive day.
A group protests outside a court against a defendant in a sexual assault case.
Kennedy Road informal settlement residents barricaded roads with rubbish and burning tyres following the decision of the eThekwini municipality to disconnect illegal electricity connections.
Shots reported fired at a ANC celebratory rally. Injuries not known.
A group protests against an ANC committee meeting.
Protesters torch councillors homes in Chiawelo over electricity supply.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: NUMSA protest for police ""tolerance.""
Protest against US action in Lybia.
Soweto residents protest a series of arrests over arson.
Three high school boys charged with murder of black South African man in what prosecutors describe as a racially motivated murder
Residents of Tshiame, outside of Harrismith, violently protest over a toilet requirement.
Sbu Sibiya, and ANC regional secretary, is shot and killed in his driveway. This is seen as an assassination.
Students riot, burn their school over an exam delay.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Metalworkers block roads in protest of their employer. Police dispersed the crowed with a water cannon.
A Stellenbosch University professor has been attacked on campus, allegedly by a member of a right-wing group over an opinion piece he wrote.
A group protests a ski lift company, claiming their business activities threaten whales.
Residents protest electricity tariffs.
Residents of Mfuleni protest at the West Cape provincial legislature over poor housing in their area.
A suspected copper thief is beaten to death.
A suspected thief is attacked by mob, though rescued by police.
Philippi residents, police clash during electricity protests.

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: COSATU protest education talks.
Members of the Right2know group protest at Parliament over their opposition to the Protection of Information Bill.
Students protest outside their rural school over a recent increase of suicides among the students.
Fuel pump workers protest for a wage increase, block roads.
Residents of Dunoon violently protest the city of Cape Town over their dismantling of structures used by backyard dwellers.
A group of fishermen protest a fishing ban along Durban beaches.
A group protests at the US Embassy in Pretoria over military activity in Libya.
A confederation of women's groups and environmental groups stage a protest on National Womans Day against the electricity creating practice known as ""fracking"".
A group protests against the fracking natural gas extraction process.
Parents protest at a school, accusing the management of nepotism and violence against children.
Large groups protest in Swellenbosch and Genadendal over ""improper"" services granted to the poor. ""Skermishes"" and one injury reported.
Large groups protest in Swellenbosch and Genadendal over ""improper"" services granted to the poor. ""Skermishes"" and one injury reported.
Members of a left-wing group protest ""this week"" at Cape Town airport upon the arrival of US military forces, who were arriving to participate in a joint humanitarian exercise.

Members of the WIVL, a socialist organization, protest the arrival of the US military groups for a joint, three-week humanitarian exercise with the South African National Defense Force outside the airport.
Residents of Genadendal protest over ""foreign nationals"" allegedly illegally occupying houses in the area to set up businesses.
Workers violently protest over pay, assaulting and intimidating workers not participating in the strike.
Students protest campus policies at the University of Free State (UFS) Bloemfontein campus.

Princess settlement residents, upon learning of their expulsion from their homes, clash with other residents and police, who fire teargas and rubber bullets at them. The expulsion was learned to be a false rumor later.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Members of SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union protest in Braamfontein on 19/08.
Electricity protest becomes violent in Tembisa.
Police arrest 43 over intimidation and public violence after a persistent foul stench in the area had upset them.
Striking municipal workers trash streets and destroy property during a protest.
A prominent ANC leader is shot and killed in Amanzimtoti on 25/08.
Arrests: An ANC chancellor is arrested for the alleged assault of a fellow ANC member.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League; Journalists (South Africa)
column17: ANCYL supporters ran riot, attacking journalists, pelting the police with stones and burning posters bearing pictures of President Jacob Zumas face. Police respond with rubber bullets. One police officer reported injured. The demonstrations last over several days (recorded as 3)

column6: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: ANCYL supporters ran riot, attacking journalists, pelting the police with stones and burning posters bearing pictures of President Jacob Zumas face. They were mainly supporters of Julius Malema. Police respond with rubber bullets. One police officer reported injured.
Violent protesting and rioting outside a hostel over the arrest of an IFP political leader.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League; Journalists (South Africa)
column17: ANCYL supporters ran riot, attacking journalists, pelting the police with stones and burning posters bearing pictures of President Jacob Zumas face. Police respond with rubber bullets. One police officer reported injured. The demonstrations last over several days (recorded as 3)
Violent backyard dweller protest in Khayelitsha. The group was protesting their exclusion from a housing project.
Violent backyard dweller protest in Khayelitsha. The group was protest their exclusion from a housing project.

A former ANCYL chairman is shot and killed inside his house. It is not clear this violence was political.
Students go on an anti-crime protest. Date(s) not known, occurred ""at the weekend.""
Protesters, unhappy a mining company hired non-locals, block roads and burn tyres for two consecutive days.
Backyard dwellers protest outside Oliver Tambo Hall over land ownership rights.
Violent service delivery protest outside Lenasia.

column17: Members of the COSATU protest in solidarity of union protest in neighboring Swaziland.

A vigilante mob attacks two suspected criminals, kills one.
65 people were arrested at Gezubuso in Bulwer Road in Pietermaritzburg following violent protests over a labour issue.
Municipal service protesters clash with police, 63 arrested.
Residents protest over housing development in Port Elizabeth.
Two community leaders arrested during a violent electricity cut protest.
A group of 200 gather to protest poor municipal service.

Protesters gather outside a Durban court against a possible bail granted to a person charged with murder.
Violent service delivery protest in Tembisa.
A group of teachers take a hostage during a security protest, demanding their requests met before the person released.
Residents protest a lack of drinking water.
Members of Greenpeace protest at the Department of Energy against the use of nuclear energy.
A group of squatters protest a lack of electricity and water inside their apartments light tires and car on fire. Police arrest 70.

column17: Gay and Lesbian activists stage local protest march
Service delivery protesters block roads, seven arrested.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspected street gang member.
People gather to protest police brutality.
Students and facility protest the exclusion of the Dali Lama from an event.
Demonstrators gather at the Western Cape legislative building to protest alleged judicial corruption.
A vigilante mob hunts and kills a man under suspicion of murder.
Members of Chavani village in Waterval stone a man to death when they suspect him of murder.
Members of the UPM protest ""greed and corruption"" by the ANC.
Five people - including two police officers - have been injured during a protest against the closure of a shebeen.
Residents stone a murder suspect to death,
On 17 October 2011, teargas was used to break up a demonstration by foreigners at a deportation center. Many fires set, no one reported injured or arrested. [size=no report]

Two vehicles belonging to a spaza shop owner were set alight in Letsitele outside Tzaneen by a mob who accused the owner of kidnapping a 22-year-old woman.

column17: Members of SACCAWU gather to protest the acquisition of a local retail company by Wal-Mart.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: 2,000 people, organized by the ANCYL, took to the streets to protest, demanding jobs and greater economic power for black people. Singing apartheid-era liberation songs and waving banners, the group marched on the Chamber of Mines in central Johannesburg before heading to the stock exchange.

Protest in Verulam when bail is granted to a charged killer.

Residents protest that the mayors office over electricity problems.

More than 500 protesters, among them editors and journalists, gathered near Parliament, calling for the ""unjust"" Protection of State Information Bill not to be passed into law. Protesters dubbed the gathering ""Black Tuesday.""
Demonstrators gather in Johannesburg to protest a controversial bill passing through parliament.
Demonstrators gather in Pretoria to protest a controversial bill passing through parliament.

Protesters block roads and burn tyres over a lack of housing.

Tenants protest eviction following a period of unpaid rent.

A group of Congolese opposition protesters are arrested when they gather to denounce Jacob Zuma. They carried posters saying President Jacob Zuma should stay out of Congolese affairs. Police fired rubber bullets to break up a group of demonstrators gathered in front of the ruling ANC party headquarters.

A group of Congolese opposition protesters are arrested by South African police when they try to storm their embassy in Pretoria. They carried posters saying President Jacob Zuma should stay out of Congolese affairs.
DRC nationals protest the alleged DRC election manipulation by the Zuma administration in Cape Town.

Nine Congolese refugees were arrested and two police officers slightly injured when police used pepper spray to disperse a crowd of about 300 protesters in the city centre. The protesters retaliated by throwing stones and destroying refuse bins. The refugees were protesting in support of Democratic Republic of Congo presidential candidate WaMulumba and accused SA preside Zuma of backing his rival.
DRC nationals violently protest, resulting in eight arrests. The group was protesting an election result in their country.
A huge vegetation fire broke out while a small group of people were burning tyres in Mew Way and Walter Sisulu Drive in Khayelitsha in protest at poor sanitation services.
Environmental protest outside of a UN climate meeting in Durban. There were reported of escalated violence between two opposing political groups.
Factions of the ANC clash over the choice of candidates. Several injuries reported.

One driver was injured and several minibus taxis damaged when the taxis were allegedly stoned by members of the Boschkop Taxi Association (BTA) near the Lynnridge mall. The unrest is believed to be in response to a recent court order which effected the two companies.
Demonstrators protest against a persistent drug problem in their area.

Violent protests have erupted at Ottoshoop between Mahikeng and Zeerust resulting in the blockading of the R49 Mahikeng-Zeerust road with burning tyres, rocks and other rabbles. It is believed the protesters were demanding a housing provision. Police were present.
Man attacks freelance journalist during ANC conference

About 70 DR Congo refugees protest against South Africas acceptance of Joseph Kabilas victory over Tshise-kedi in the DRC presidential elections of November 28. Police rushed the group and hit many of the protesters with batons before arresting them.
A group of men stoned a Sangoma man to death and severely injured another when the group believed they were involved with the abduction of a child. They were later arrested.
A vigilante group stones a traditional death over the alleged abduction of a child. Four members of the group were later arrested.

column9: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions

Animal rights group protests outside circus

Anti-Obama protesters gather at the University of Cape Town during an on campus speech by the President. The groups protest was focused on 'war crimes' allegedly perpetrated by Obama's administration.
Members of the UPM gather outside a housing construction zone and protest for greater transparency for the beneficiary waiting lists for the project.
Demonstrators blocked a portion of the N2 highway in Khayelitsha with toilet pots full of faeces and burning tires in protest of poor sanitation practices.

A group of protesters barricade the R31 road with burning tires and barbed wire, demanding that their mayor and the newly appointed municipal manager at Kgatelopele Municipality leave the town. Police fired rubber bullets at the group after the rioters began throwing stones at them

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Striking municipal workers are attacked by the Red Ants militia eviction squad as they protested outside a building. The militia assaulted the group with rubber bullets and crowbars. Causalities unknown.
Members of the ANC burnt party T-shirts outside the Tlokwe local municipality offices in Potchefstroom in protest against the expulsion of 14 councillors from the party.

Gunmen open fire on a car carrying Nigerians, four reported deaths. Motivation unknown, though recently some Nigerians living in South Africa were reported to have been victims of violence allegedly fuelled by xenophobia.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Metrobus workers gathered outside the companies depot in the city centre to protest against what they called ""a violation of company policies"". Along with the protest the group began a labour strike.
A City of Cape Town water sanitation vehicle was set alight, allegedly by a group of protesters angry after seven of their comrades were denied bail by the Bellville Magistrates Court.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a man in a vehicle. The motive for the attack is unknown - the perpetrators did not attempt to rob or carjack the victim.
About 200 people gathered to protest against the forceful removal by police of a blind street musician from a shopping centre.

A group of protesters stage a sit-in outside of Galeshewe police station to demand a anti-gang vigilante group be released from custody. The vigilante group had been arrested early in the morning after a suspected gangsters home had been pelted with rocks.

Protesters burn documents containing the names of housing beneficiaries in Missionvale in a demonstration to express their displease of a of a ward councillor not getting a specific political appointee into office.

A vigilante group of residents attack their neighbours home with rocks and other items. The group believes the man is a drug kingpin. It is not clear if the man was inside the home, or if the attackers posed any threat to him physically.
Khayelitsha residents protest against bad policing and slow housing delivery over several days.
Mosque and Church groups protest the opening of a Liquor Store, which is located in the same neighbourhood as their facilities.
Khayelitsha residents protest against bad policing and slow housing delivery over several days.
A Democratic Alliance organized protest over water problems in Brandfort occurred at Masilonyana municipal offices in Theunissen.

Lecturers at the South West Gauteng Further Education and Training (FET) College's Dobsonville campus in Soweto went on a wildcat strike and chased the campus manager, Busisiwe Setati, out of the college, accusing her of nepotism and failing to provide leadership.
Residents of a hostel protest against debilitating conditions ""violently"". The nature of the violence is not clear.
Khayelitsha residents protest against bad policing and slow housing delivery burnt tires and blocked Pama Road in the early hours of the morning.
Hundreds of people gathered outside Parliament in Cape Town to protest against the ouster of Mohamed Mursi in Egypt. The protest was organized by the MJC.
UNISA students protest the non-payment of student fees by a national funding scheme.
Khayelitsha residents protest against bad policing and slow housing delivery over several days. Here, protesters block Pama Road for two consecutive days.
UNISA students protest the non-payment of student fees by a national funding scheme.
UNISA students protest the non-payment of student fees by a national funding scheme. A number of the students block access to the campus.

100 Portaloo protesters gather at Western Cape High court to demand the release of seven of their leaders being held without bail. The seven arrested after they threw faeces onto the grounds of Cape Town International Airport. The groups goal is higher standards of public sanitation.
A group of 1,500 students from North West University protest alleged racism by the leadership of the University.
A group of 800 students gather in downtown Durban demanding that they be given laptops and financial support. The group blocked a road known for heavy traffic.
SASCO protesters march demanding free education for the poor.

Between 500 to 1000 power plant workers protest dissatisfaction with one of the allowances. At times the demonstration became violent, many of the protesters threw rocks at passing cars, though no injury was caused.
Agang members on a recruitment drive exchanged blows with local ANC members resulting in a car belonging to ANC councillor Sammy Mathebula being damaged.

Residents of Siluma Section in Katlehong protest for two consecutive days, calling for an early childhood school closing. The protesters believe the administrators have abused children. The exact dates of the event are speculative.
SASCO members threw eggs at police and education officials in protest for free education.
500 members or supporters of SAMA protest poor conditions of public government hospitals.

Residents of Siluma Section in Katlehong protest for two consecutive days, calling for an early childhood school closing. The protesters believe the administrators have abused children. The exact dates of the event are speculative.
Protesters blocked a road and stoned passing vehicles in the Du Noon area of Milnerton, Cape Town over service delivery. Police dispersed the crowd with stun grenades.
Protesters ripped African National Congress t-shirts in protest after an economic group was barred from entering University of Johannesburgs Doornfontein campus.

A group of protesters barricaded the N2 highway with portable toilets and burning tires and flung faeces at vehicles. Police dispersed the group with tear gas canisters. The demonstrators are calling for improved sanitation practices.
A mine worker is shot and killed in a suspected labour union dispute.
A group of 30 protest against South African affirmative action polices outside a Cape Town Labour Court. The group advocated employment on the basis of merit, not colour.
Caregivers of AIDS patients gathered in Johannesburg to demand to be directly in the employ of the department of health - instead of volunteering for NGOs.
Three Zimbabwean exiles on staged a pre-election protest against Robert Mugabe in Sandton City centre.
Scores of residents marched through the streets of Manenberg, the scene of a number of recent gang shootings, demanding that gangsters stop fighting one another.
Farmers and residents in the Amahlathi District Municipality marched against lack of service delivery.
Members of NUM marched on the headquarters of Exxaro and Sibanye Gold to demand higher wages.
Members of NUM marched on the headquarters of Exxaro and Sibanye Gold to demand higher wages.
Right2Know protesters gathered outside the offices of The Independent Communications Authority of South Africa and called for regulation of cell phone airtime rates.
Cars and windows were damaged with stones and desks were set alight by Matthew Goniwe Memorial High School pupils who demanded that suspended classmates be allowed to return to school.
Sanitation service delivery protesters gather outside of a court house where their recently arrested compatriots were receiving a legal hearing. The group sang protest songs and ""toyi-toyied.""
Restaurant workers protest for higher wages.
Led by leaders of Agang, employees of a security firm protest current labour relations.
A man is stoned to death for unknown reason in the Jabulani area of Soweto.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: Supporters of the ANCYL emptied portaloos in front of the provincial legislature on Wale Street in Cape Town in a renewed protest for sanitation. Following the protest police begin a search for those responsible.
Port Elizabeth College students protest after they are refused a meeting with the schools administrator. Police arrived to the scene and fired rubber bullets to disperse the group.
Portaloo protesters demonstrate outside the Cape Town Magistrates Court where 183 accused were set to appear for charges related to past portaloo protests.
A group protests against poor living conditions in Fochville, a township west of Johannesburg. The group demanded better homes and access to running water.

Denouncing dirty energy, earthlife activists marched to Anglos offices in Johannesburgs Parktown area against the companies planned coal mine and power station in Waterberg, Limpopo. The protesters carried placards that read: ""Anglo you have a Choice - Go Renewable Now!"", and ""No to Energy Injustice!""

The employees of Leitch Landscapes strike and protest along beachfront Durban, calling for increased wages. The group purposefully destroyed landscaping along the beach, an area they were hired to maintain. The protest lasted three consecutive days.
Traffic in Khayelitsha was diverted after residents yesterday protested against the use of portable toilets, and the lack of basic services, houses and roads.

Residents demanding better living conditions protest for a second consecutive day, but the crowd went on the rampage Wednesday, burning the house of a councillor representing the countries ruling ANC party and looting shops. Police forces fired rubber bullets at the crowd and made 45 arrests.

A service delivery protest in the rural town of Ntabankulu burst into violence yesterday when angry protesters damaged several staff vehicles and smashed windows. Police arrested at least 30 demonstrators.

The N2 in Cape Town had to be closed once again as informal settlement residents threw tires, stones and buckets full of human faeces on the national highway in protest of sanitation practices and service delivery.

The employees of Leitch Landscapes strike and protest along beachfront Durban, calling for increased wages. The group purposefully destroyed landscaping along the beach, an area they were hired to maintain. The protest lasted three consecutive days.
Service delivery protesters clash with police in Protea South
Police disperse service delivery protesters with rubber bullets.

The employees of Leitch Landscapes strike and protest along beachfront Durban, calling for increased wages. The group purposefully destroyed landscaping along the beach, an area they were hired to maintain. The protest lasted three consecutive days.
More than 100 gay and lesbian activists marched down Oxford Street in East London on Saturday protesting against assault and discrimination.

Police arrest 22 service delivery protesters in Protea South. Police became involved after the protesters burnt tyres, blockaded roads and threw stones. The group had been protesting service delivery two consecutive days prior.

Activists from the Social Justice Coalition (SJC) staged a picket outside the Langa Methodist Church where National Police Commissioner Riah Phiyega was addressing a service. The SJC was demand the release of Angry Peter, a man charged with kidnapping, who they believe to be innocent.
Service delivery protesters burn trash and tires on Cape Towns N2 highway, causing heavy traffic problems. The police did not become involved.
An unknown person entered the home of ANC leader the evening of 11/08, murdering him. The motive for the shooting is not known and no arrest has been made.
South African women who are married to Nigerian nationals staged a protest against stop societal discrimination against them.
About 1000 residents of the Nonyi informal settlement in Mandeni embarked on a service delivery protest. Residents threw stones at police, who used rubber bullets and teargas to disperse them.
Shack dwellers in the North Coast town of Etete, between Shakaskraal and Groutville, have blocked the R102 for two days and are demanding houses in a service delivery protest.
A labour union official is shot and killed near the organizations headquarters.
Shack dwellers in the North Coast town of Etete, between Shakaskraal and Groutville, have blocked the R102 for two days and are demanding houses in a service delivery protest.
A group protest Fidentia, an investment group, for payouts owed to them.

Pupils at New Eisleben Secondary School stoned a Cape Argus photographer's vehicle on Wednesday morning during violent protests against the school's principal. Garbage was also dumped in the schools corridors. Upon arriving, fired a tear gas canister to disperse the pupils.
Thirty-five protesters are arrested after they blocked traffic in the Vaal Triangle. The demonstrators had recently been released from their places of employment and were pushing for reinstatement.
Members of supporters of the SADC protest the regional endorsement of recent Zimbabwe elections outside the Parliament building.
A group of New Brighton residents protested outside the Port Elizabeth Magistrates Court demanding that a man, who allegedly beat his 12-year-old son to death, be refused bail.
The home of an ANC councillor is set alight with his two children inside. It isnt clear if they were harmed. The group attacked the home due to anger over recently demolished shacks.

Several ANC Members of Parliament, including Police Committee Chairperson Annelize van Wyk, marched on the Western Cape Provincial Legislature in protest against gang related crime in the Western Cape.
A police officer is shot dead with a high-calibre weapon while on duty.
A group protests a speech by Noxolo Kiviet by burning ANC-T t-shirts outside the speaking venue. Kiviet and her provincial executive were in Sterkspruit as part of their Womens Month programme.
Alexandra residents protest over title deeds outside the Union Buildings in Pretoria.
Communities protest poor water supply to rural areas.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Striking NUMSA Ford employees protest for a pay increase.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Thousands of NUMSA auto workers took to the streets outside General Motors, Ford and Volkswagen plants to demand a pay raise.

Residents of Orange Farm burnt tires and placed rocks on main roads. The protesters had also placed rocks and burning tires between Welgevonden Road and Palm Springs Mall. It is not clear why the group is protesting.
Members of the MJC marched from Keizersgracht to Parliament against the military coup in Egypt.
A group of protesters burnt tires and threw rocks at motorists along Randfontein Road in Roodepoort. It is not clear why the group was protesting.
Thirty violent sanitation protesters are arrested over the course of a two day demonstration in the Joe Slovo settlement in Milnerton. The protesters burned tires and threw rocks.

A portion of the N2 at Mew Way is closed after violent sanitation protesters began throw rocks at motorists and faeces on the highway. The police dispersed the crowd with stun-guns and rubber bullets, but not before several arrests were made.
Sanitation protesters clash with policed in Khayelitsha for a second consecutive day.
Thirty violent sanitation protesters are arrested over the course of a two day demonstration in the Joe Slovo settlement in Milnerton. The protesters burned tires and threw rocks.
A men's group protest to end gender-based violence in the country.
Labour groups protest in Eastern Province for higher pay. The location within the state is not known.

Thousands of workers marched to the electricity parastatal Eskom, the Chamber of Mines and the South African Federation of Civil Engineering Contractors (SAFCEC) in Johannesburg to press for a higher pay.

column16: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: Members of National Union of Mineworkers (NUM) march in Park Town, Johannesburg march to handover memoranda of demands, including a request to ""stop bullying employees"" to Eskom, the Chamber of Mines and the South African Federation of Civil Engineering Contractors (SAFCEC).
Labour groups protest in KwaZulu-Natal Province for higher pay. The location within the state is not known.
Two people have been stabbed during a strike in Sandown, Johannesburg. It is not clear if the two victims were protesting at the time of their attack or if they succumbed to their injuries.
ANC protesters gather outside the mayors office in Tlokwe demanding that the 14 ANC councillors who were recently fired be reinstated.

Protesting Walter Sisulu University students clash with police. A number of students were allegedly shot with rubber bullets and the injured rushed to Frere Hospital. The students were protesting a labour issue.
A series of violent protests erupt in Cape Town, suspected to be led by the ANC. Reports of cars being stoned and fires on the N2 highway. No report of injuries.

A group of military veterans stage a violent protest outside Germiston Civic Centre in Ekurhuleni. About 60 people were arrested and charged with theft, vandalism, trespassing, and assault. It is not clear why the group was protesting.
A man accused of rape narrowly escapes a mob of rioters who had gathered to protest outside his home.

Student protesters clash with police at Walter Sisulu University of Technology campus in Butterworth. Twelve injuries. Outrage followed the universities announcement on Tuesday that it was closing due to weeks of labour strife. Police disperse the students with tear gas.

Police used a stun grenade to disperse demonstrators outside the Ashton Magistrate's Court, where the group had assembled to protest a farmer who had allegedly assaulted an employee. The farmer had gone to court for a hearing.

Mine accident mourners protest Minister in the Presidency Trevor Manuel after he refused to answer questions after a speech at Wits University. The protesters believe government policy was to blame for the accident.

Thousands of protesters in red T-shirts and caps marched to the police commissioners Pretoria office under the banner of the Police and Prisons Civil Rights Union. They are demanding that the South African Police Service carry out the directives of a 2011 agreement to adjust the salaries and upgrade the level of police administrative staff.
A group of Muslim South Africans protest outside the Egyptian embassy against the removal of Morsi as President.
Protesters gathered outside the Wits Great Hall in protest at the Israeli saxophonists performance of a controversial song they believed to be anti-Semitic.
Residents protesting rolling power outages clash with police.

Members of the Egyptian community of Pretoria gathered at Cairos embassy for a peaceful demonstration to express the support of the removal of Morsi as President and to push for the restoration of democracy.
Residents of a low cost housing unit barricade themselves in their housing complex following a refusal to pay rent. Police dispersed the crowed and opened the barricade late in the day.

Members of a construction labour union protest, attack union scabs at a construction site. Many people were seriously injured, damage to property and vehicles reported. In addition, threats of intimidation were reported - some members of the union threatened to burn down the homes of those who work.
Service delivery protesters burned down a government building and looted the local shopping centre.
65 service delivery protesters are arrest when become violent and destructive toward property.

column7: SADTU: South African Democratic Teachers Union
column17: Striking teachers union members disrupt the administering of examinations thought the city by blocking the entrance to the lecture hall where the tests were given. Districts affected include: Umlazi, Pinetown, Uthungulu (Richards Bay) and Ilembe (Ballito).
Reported arson attack the ANC headquarters in Johannesburg. It is not clear if any officials of the ANC were inside the building at the time.

Members of a construction labour union protest, attack union scabs at a construction site. Many people were seriously injured, damage to property and vehicles reported. In addition, threats of intimidation were reported - some members of the union threatened to burn down the homes of those who work.
Following strike action by municipal workers, a group protests for a second day in Johannesburg. Since the strike began there had been reports of power supply sabotage throughout the city.
Police said 33 people were arrested in Piketberg as protesters demanding land to squat on closed the N7 from about 11.30am to 1.30pm by burning tires.

Unconfirmed reports of violence against civilians from striking mineworkers in several locations around the city of Cape Town. The sites of protests included Mew Way, Lansdowne Road, Heideveld and Borcherds Quarry, as well as other locations. Police forces have dispersed several gatherings.
Following strike action by municipal workers, a group protests in Johannesburg. Since the strike began there had been reports of power supply sabotage throughout the city.

Unconfirmed reports of violence against civilians from striking mineworkers in several locations around the city of Cape Town. The sites of protests included Mew Way, Lansdowne Road, Heideveld and Borcherds Quarry, as well as other locations. Police forces have dispersed several gatherings.

Strikers armed with whips and knobkieries had several construction sites closed in the Helderberg - including large residential and retail centre projects near Somerset Mall. At one point police used stun grenades to disperse a group of protesters.
Eight members of the Economic Freedom Fighters held a brief picket outside the Gauteng police headquarters in Johannesburg against the newly appointed police commissioner.
Property destruction: Two unidentified men burn down a radio station for suspected political reasons.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: NUMSA protests for two days in Stikland during a motor service industry strike. Petrol attendants joined fellow Numsa members on the first day.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Hundreds of striking National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa (Numsa) members gathered in Randburg to demonstrate in support of higher wages in the motor industry. The strikers wore red T-shirts emblazoned with their demands, which included a skills-based grading system and a 40 hour working week.

The Right2Know Campaign held a protest on the street corner opposite the ANCs Luthuli House headquarters in Johannesburg on Monday over a lack of protection for whistleblowers and the ""secrecy bill"". About 20 people gathered, with more than half wearing white skull Halloween masks and carrying posters as they formed a semicircle on the street corner.
Following a large truck accident on the M13 highway, a small number of protesters gather at the scene to call for a ban of heavy vehicles on the route.
A man in a group of striking taxi drivers is shot and wounded by an unknown man who neared them in a vehicle.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Hundreds of National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa members marched to the National Automobile Manufacturers of South Africa offices in Pretoria to demanding higher wages.

A group of people protesting in support of Marikana workers began singing and dancing in the University of Witwatersrands Great Hall on Tuesday evening, ahead of a speech by deputy chairman of the National Planning Commission Cyril Ramaphosa, whom they oppose.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: NUMSA protests for two days in Stikland during a motor service industry strike.

A female bystander is shot and wounded in violence related to taxi strikes. The intended target of the perpetrator is believed to be a taxi driver. The shooting came a day after a Diepsloot man was wounded after taxi drivers in the area went on strike.

A group of residents chased away a high-profile ANC delegation after accusing them of a politically motivated visit. Residents also protested against the alleged presence of officials of the South African Social Security Agency (Sassa) in the ANC entourage.

column6: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: A 55-year-old petrol station attendant is beaten to death by a group of NUMSA strikers.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Members of the striking National Union of Mineworkers (NUM) invaded a sand mine in Macassar early in the day, overpowered two security guards, assaulted them and torched three diggers and an excavator. The attack was likely strike/labour related.

Nineteen members of the Social Justice Coalition were arrested after chaining themselves to railings outside Cape Town civic centre. The demonstration had been arranged in an attempt to get Cape Town mayor Patricia de Lille to find a solution to the growing sanitation concerns in Khayelitsha.

Residents of Waterworks (Waterwack) informal settlement in Zuurbekom took to the streets as early as 3am to protest poor service delivery. The protesters burned tires and threw rocks at police. A total of 176 people were arrested for public violence and malicious damage to property.

Residents of Waterworks (Waterwack) informal settlement in Zuurbekom took to the streets in Soweto, rioting in protest poor service delivery. Tires set alight, roads barricaded and rocks were reportedly thrown.

Residents of Waterworks (Waterwack) informal settlement in Zuurbekom took to the streets in Protea, rioting in protest poor service delivery. Tires set alight, roads barricaded and rocks were reportedly thrown.

column6: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: A petrol attendant is beaten to death while working at a garage on the Cape Flats. The attack is likely related to an ongoing NUMSA strike.
Parents, unhappy of the news of a school merger affecting their children, protest outside its entrance after they were denied a reversal in the ruling.

Police fired rubber bullets and tear gas at protesters who took to the streets in Johannesburg in anger over the lack of government services. The protesters burnt tires in the street and threw rocks at police.
Striking petrol attendants demonstrate in protest of a salary increase.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Thousands of striking Numsa workers marched through Port Elizabeths city centre - the unions leaders warning the ANC not to take its votes for granted.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: 8 000 motor industry workers affiliated to the National Union of Metalworkers of SA (Numsa) marched in Durban to present a memorandum to employer organisations, which included labour demands. Many of the protesters carried weapons, but there were no reports of violence. Additionally, there were reports of union intimidation against shops that refused to close.
Hundreds of demonstrators marched on South Africas government headquarters to protest a lack of state funding for survivors of police shootings at the Marikana mine, where 44 people have died.

2,000 miners and members of opposition political parties protest under the banner group ""Citizens4Marikana"" in a march to the Union Buildings in Pretoria, demanding the government meet the demands of the victims of the Marikana killing. Armed riot police kept a close watch on the protesters, but did not engage them.
Citizens4Marikana marches for the second consecutive day.

column6: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Striking NUMSA members assault a petrol station employee who was not participating in the nationwide labour stoppage.

On 15 September 2013, residents riot, attack foreign owned shops in New Brighton. The riot was sparked after a Somali shop owner shot a 19-year-old South African man following an argument. [size=no report]
Treatment Action Campaign (TAC) protest with placecards demanding greater access for HIV treatment drugs. The protested began in Cape Towns Keizersgracht area.
A group of parting marshals protest outside their companies officers over a labour disagreement.
Prisoners riot and damage proptery at Mangaung Correctional Centre.

Violence against Somali shop owners and their property continues for four consecutive days, following the shooting of local by a Somali after a private dispute. 150 or shop were effected by the fourth day of rioting.

Students of the Tshwane North Further Education and Training College in Soshanguve barricaded the gate of their school with burning tires in protest against the college managements failure to pay them their National Student Financial Aid Scheme funds as promised.

Violence against Somali shop owners and their property continues for four consecutive days, following the shooting of local by a Somali after a private dispute. 150 or shop were effected by the fourth day of rioting.
ANC supporters assaults a DA supporter and rip him of his party t-shirt.

Violence against Somali shop owners and their property continues for four consecutive days, following the shooting of local by a Somali after a private dispute. 150 or shop were effected by the fourth day of rioting.
Area residents protest poor sewage infrastructure. Several of the protesters are arrested after they became violent. Exact date of the event is not clear.
A group of parents and children gather to protest recent murders in the area.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU Cape Town municipal service workers at a waster water centre stop work to protest alleged racism at the management level.
Members of the Communist Party marched in protest against alleged housing corruption in two locations in the Johannesburg metro.
Members of the Communist Party marched in protest against alleged housing corruption in two locations in the Johannesburg metro.
