Bus drivers strike over wages, erect burning barricades and throw stones at police who respond with rubber bullets.
Police arrest of six local residents accused to taking part in riots in the Kirwood area last month. Local residents demonstrates against the arrests by clashing with police using sticks and stones.
Students march in Port Elizabeth to raise awareness about breast cancer.
A group of Jewish protesters demonstrate outside Woolworths in Sea Point. The outlet has been targeted by anti-Israel protests led by South African student organisations.
Over 400 pupils march to the provincial legislature to call on the Education Department to assure pupil safety while travelling to and from school in violence-ridden communities.

column7: NASECGWU: National Security, Commercial and General Workers Union
column17: Workers picket outside the Tokai estate, demanding 10% more in wages, and complaining that coloured employees were favoured ahead of black Africans.
50 angry protesters wearing ANC T-shirts chanted slogans outside the Mbizana Magistrates Court to oppose the bail proceedings of three individuals accused of vandalising a monument to Oliver Tambo.
Residents protest against criminal activities taking place in a dilapidated building in their neighbourhood.
Nine dismissed councellors occupy a municipal building and refuse to leave until they are evicted by the police.
Duncan Village residents burn tyros and threw garden refuse and rubble onto the main road in a protest related to housing.
Residents block the road and riot over lack of water service provision. The rioters are dispersed by the police with rubber bullets.
Residents block the road and riot over lack of water service provision. The rioters are dispersed by the police with rubber bullets.
Delivery trucks are set on fire. The perpetrators are suspected to be striking workers.
Delivery trucks are set on fire. The perpetrators are suspected to be striking workers.
Villagers block the road with burning tyres and rocks in protest of poor service delivery.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Striking workers picket a Checkers warehouse. No violence reported.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Striking workers protest and demand higher wages. No violence reported.
Hundreds of people march against the attacks on the al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem. The protest is spearheaded by the Muslim Judicial Council.
The leader of the Seskhona Peoples Rights Movement is shot by unknown perpetrators. The group claims that the shooting was politically motivated. The victim remains in critical condition.

A truck belonging to the Twizza and Crickley Dairy company and an employees house are gutted by arsonists. The perpetrators are suspected to be striking workers though the Food and Allied Workers Union has denied any link.
More than 200 members of the Earthlife Africa organisation protested outside the French Embassy in Pretoria to voice their dissatisfaction with a proposed multi-billion rand nuclear facility deal.
The DA lead a demonstration outside the headquarters of the South African National Roads Agency to protest against the implementation of E-tolls.
A group of Amalinda Forest residents dump human faeces from their community toilet at the offices of their ward councillor in protest of poor service delivery in the ward.

Hundreds of Seskhona supporters march to Cape Town train station to hand a memorandum to Prasa (Passenger Rail Agency of South Africa) in connection with jobs. The group then attempts to march to the local ANC offices but are barred by policeman. The demonstration peaefully disperses.
An ANC councillor is shot at by unidentified assailants. The attack comes a day after the shooting of a Seskhona activist, which members of the group blamed on the ANC.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: NUMSA members protest outside COSATU House in support of their leaders. NUMSA faces being expelled from the Trade Union collective.
Four people are shot dead by unknown assailants. The victims are said to have recently defected to the IFP. The killings are suspected to be politically motivated.
Residents march against ongoing gang violence in the local area.
The director of education for Ehlanzeni district is attacked by enraged parents after telling them that a school would be closed due its its use of corporal punishment .

The EFF attempts to appropriate council-owned land and redistribute it to landless local residents. The residents had been waiting on public housing that had not been delivered. The police fire rubber bullets at the residents resulting in injuries.
Mobeni Khwela, an ANC activist and vocal opponent on the incumbent ANC councillor in KwaNdengezi , is shot dead by unknown assailants at his home in the township.

Security officers at Chromex Chrome Mineuse rubber bullets to disperse a group of angry residents who barricaded the road leading to the mine with burning debris. The residents were protesting against the companies failure to develop the area.
Residents march against ongoing gang violence in the local area.

Police clash with residents attempting to build on land owned by the council. The residents had been waiting for the council to deliver public housing and had started building their own shacks. The rioters were supported by the EFF.
Duncan Village residents march to the mayors office demanding to know why a number of residents by been denied access to housing.
Protesters picket outside Goodwood Magistrates Court calling for bail to be denied to the six people accused of hacking a teenager to death.

column7: TAC: Treatment Action Campaign; Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: Nyanga, Gugulethu, Philippi and Crossroads residents protest at the Fezeka Health District office to demand better health services. The march, organised by the Treatment Action Campaign (TAC), was attended by about 200 people.
The Democratic Alliance lead a protest against rising levels of crime.

A fight erupts in parliament over the issue of Zumas upgrades to his residence in Nkandla. Riot police are called in to quell the fighting and EFF politicians are hurt. There are conflicting reports over whether the EFF MPs attacked the police or vice-versa.

A suspected thief is tortured and beaten by residents. It was reported that he later dies of his injuries but later reports indicate that the victim survived by playing dead. Police were present at the scene of the assault but did not intervene.

Reiger Park residents protest outside a courthouse after a man accused of killing a local 4-year-old in a carjacking is released. The protesters shout death threats at the accused and at local officials. There are no reports of violence or destruction of property.
A group of individuals wearing security company outfits severely assault a Nigerian couple. The Nigerian couple are verbally abused by staff prior to being assaulted.

EFF members armed with pangas violently clash with each other during the parties provincial conference. The violence may be tied to competition for provincial leadership posts. They are violently dispersed by private security hired by EFF head Julius Malema.
An unknown group burn down the municipal managers offices.
Taxi drivers strike over the imposition of an e-toll system, causing a gridlock in Johannesburg. There are reports of intimidation but no reports of injuries.

Rioters obstruct the road with burning debris and demand the resignation of the local councillor Mduduzi Ngcobo and access to RDP houses. The riot started after the funeral of Abahlali baseMjondolo activist Mobeni Khwela, who was killed in a suspected assassination.
Residents block roads with barricades and burn municipal vehicles. The demonstrators call for the removal of the mayor, William Mogongwa, councillors and several officials deployed by the ANC.
400 demonstrators block the road and damage water tanks in a service delivery protest.
DA members protest outside the houses of parliament. The protest focussed on President Zumas reluctance to enter parliament and answer questions from the opposition.
Police reservists stage a sit-in outside the SAPS headquarters after their demands for unconditional integration into the go unanswered.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU members protest outside the Civic Center and threaten to go on strike if their wage demands are not met.
Shoppers assault a group of men accused of engaging in ATM fraud. The victims survive the attack.
A mob beats a suspected thief to death.
Pro-Palestine activists who stage a protest outside the headquarters of Woolworths. The demonstration was organised by the National Coalition for Palestine.
DA members protest outside the trial of a man accused of beating an elderly woman and her son to death.
A group burns tyres and blocks the road in rubble in an demonstration over RDP houses.

Approximately 300 members of the ANC and EFF demonstrated against municipal corruption and Zumas use of public funds to upgrade his home in Nkandla. Rioters pelt vehicles with stones and burn tyres.The police disperse the rioters with stun grenades.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress
column17: Approximately 300 members of the ANC and EFF demonstrated against municipal corruption and Zumas use of public funds to upgrade his home in Nkandla. Rioters pelt vehicles with stones and burn tyres.The police disperse the rioters with stun grenades.
Residents protest outside the trial of a mother and grandmother accused of killing an infant. The protesters demonstrated against the unwillingness of police to respond to reports of abuse.

Activists protest outside the High Court in Johannesburg ahead of an application for a list of South Africas national key points to be made public. Civic organisations have argued that the secrecy surrounding national key points had been ""used to undermine"" the right to know and to protest in public spaces.

Approximately 300 members of the ANC and EFF demonstrated against municipal corruption and Zumas use of public funds to upgrade his home in Nkandla. Rioters pelt vehicles with stones and burn tyres.The police disperse the rioters with stun grenades.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress
column17: Approximately 300 members of the ANC and EFF demonstrated against municipal corruption and Zumas use of public funds to upgrade his home in Nkandla. Rioters pelt vehicles with stones and burn tyres.The police disperse the rioters with stun grenades.
A senior ANC politician is stabbed repeatedly in his bed by unidentified assailants in an assault allegedly connected to a feud between Tshwane ANC factions.

Protesters block a highway with rocks and tyres near Ivanhoe Mines Platreef project to demonstrate against plans to start building the $1.6 billion (R17.6bn) platinum mine. Police disperse the protest with rubber bullets.
Demonstrators break public property during a protest against the demolition of illegal shacks.

Residents calling for the removal of the mayor, municipal manager and several councillors of the Dikgatlong Municipality riot and petrol bomb the house of the local ANC branch secretary, seriously injuring his children.
An unidentified group petrol bombs the house of an ANC municipal employee, causing serious injuries.
Taxi drivers march to the local municipal offices to protest against the allocation of taxi routes and the lack of police responsiveness to taxi-related violence.
Residents confront the police and burn tyres in protest against the raids conducted against illegal sand mining operations. The demonstrators complain that it is too difficult to get mining permits.
Community members, supported by the Treatment Action Campaign, protest against the bail of a rape suspect outside the Lusikisiki Magistrate Court.

column7: TAC: Treatment Action Campaign; SJC: Social Justice Coalition; SWEAT: Sex Workers Education and Advocacy Taskforce; Sonke Gender Justice; Women (South Africa)
column17: Activists march on parliament demanding a national plan to combat violence against women and children.

Approximately 1000 foreign nationals protest outside the Customs House building due to confusion over refugee applications. The demonstrators destroy property before violently clashing with police. They are dispersed with rubber bullets and tear-gas.
Angry protesters hold Barkly West hostage and refuse municipal workers entry to collect refuse. The demonstration has been accompanied by incidences of arson and residents arming themselves.
An alleged rapist is beaten to death by local residents.
Angry protesters hold Barkly West hostage and refuse municipal workers entry to collect refuse. The demonstration has been accompanied by incidences of arson and residents arming themselves.
A suspected murderer is severely beaten by residents.
Residents march to protest against rising gang crime in the area.
Angry protesters hold Barkly West hostage and refuse municipal workers entry to collect refuse. The demonstration has been accompanied by incidences of arson and residents arming themselves.
LGBT community members and sex workers march against violence against sex workers.
EFF members burn their shirts in protest of the appointment of a convicted murderer to a provincial post.

Around 1 December 2014 (as reported), Somali-owned shops were attacked with petrol bombs in Durban (KwaZulu-Natal). In one of the attacks, two men threw a petrol bomb inside a Somali shop, injuring the shop owner and his assistant. [size=no report]
An angry crowd attack the Child Welfare Building after the trial of a mother and grandmother, accused of abusing and killing a 3-year-old.
Informal settlement residents block roads to keep Nelson Mandela Bay Municipality from demolishing their shacks
Angry protesters hold Barkly West hostage and refuse municipal workers entry to collect refuse. The demonstration has been accompanied by incidences of arson and residents arming themselves.
Informal settlement residents block roads to keep Nelson Mandela Bay Municipality from demolishing their shacks
A cable thief is severely beaten by residents
Angry protesters hold Barkly West hostage and refuse municipal workers entry to collect refuse. The demonstration has been accompanied by incidences of arson and residents arming themselves.
Residents of an informal settlement barricade the road with burning tyres and rubble in protest against the demolition of shacks at the invaded municipal land.
Protesters block the road with burning debris. The group is reportedly linked to the protesters in Nellmapius who are protesting against their eviction from illegally occupied land.
Rioters demonstrate over electricity provision. Police arrest demonstrators at the scene of the riot.
Residents and police were engaged in running battles at Mokgolobotho village during protests over water shortages.

EFF members are present at a protest by informal residents against the demolition of their shacks by the council. Demonstrators continued to blockade the road with debris. EFF members reportedly threatened to necklace two journalists, there were however no reports of violence against civilians.
50 protesters march on Deneysville police station demanding the resignation of station commander Captain Moipone Mosotho. The protest comes after the shooting of a black teenager by white policemen.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Hundreds of Extended Public Works Programme (EPWP) employees picket outside the City of Cape Town offices demanding permanent employment. The South African Municipality Workers Union join the protest in solidarity with the EPWP workers.
Residents destroy shacks and properties that reportedly belong to sex workers. Suspected sex workers are also aprehended by residents. There are no reports of injuries or violence.
Residents and church leaders march against the high levels of violence against women and children in South Africa. The demonstration was part of the 16 Days of Activism campaign.

AN ANC member shoots and wounds two people at the parties branch meeting in KwaXimba. Another ANC member was purposely run over by a car.The fighting started when unruly ANC members were denied entry to the event. No reproted fatalities.
Ten police officers apprehend and torture a man suspected of theft to death.
6 bodies are found. Local residents say that the victims were killed by vigilantes.
Police, supported by the Red Ants, demolish 150 illegal shacks and clash with the shack dwellers who argue that the EFF said that they could have the land.

Somali-owned shops are petrol-bombed resulting in serious injuries. The attackers are believed to be Abahwebi baKwaMashu, a group representing local tradespeople who have threatened to remove non-South African business owners.

column7: ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League; Women (South Africa)
column17: ANCWL members protest and chase a party official during an elective conference.
EFF members protest during the EFF elective conference over alleged vote-rigging.
Demonstrators throw faeces at Ixopo municipal offices after meeting with local authorities to air their grievances.
A man accused of a series of assaults against women is killed by local residents.
Rioters burn tyres and stone cars. The demonstrations were reportedly instigated by local ANC politicians who were unhappy with a recent municipal appointment.
Rioters burn tyres and stone cars. The demonstrations were reportedly instigated by local ANC politicians who were unhappy with a recent municipal appointment.
Demonstrators throw faeces at Kokstad municipal offices after meeting with local authorities to air their grievances.
Illegal squatters clashed with police who had been sent to evict them from private land. Police used a water cannon to disperse the group.

Multiple Somali-owned shops are petrol-bombed. The attackers are believed to be Abahwebi baKwaMashu, a group representing local tradespeople who have threatened to remove non-South African business owners. No injuries reported.
The EFF stage a protest outside a luxury hotel in solidarity with an OAP who was evicted due to unpaid levies.
Community members protest outside the trial of seven men accused of killing a man who allegedly terrorised the local community.
On 21 December 2014, a community militia killed a man in Tiryville after his son stabbed a resident to death in a dispute.
Residents protest outside the Buffalo City Metro electricity department after 100 houses are left without power during a powercut.
Two men are stoned by a mob of residents. One of the men died on the scene while the other subsequently died in hospital.

A fight erupts between armed men from Hamsini and Ntsimbini villages. The two groups attack each other with pangas and spears. One person dies at the scene of the fight. It is unknown what initiated the battle.
Nyandeni mayor Thokozile Sokhanyile visits Hamsini to address inter-communal tensions in the area. Hamsini villagers pelt the mayors car with stones and blocake the road.
Residents attack three Chinese shop-keepers. The shop-keepers had previously hospitalised two local teenagers who they suspected of stealing.

A mob of Hamsini residents enter Ntsimbini village to avenge the death of a Hamsini villager who died in a fight with armed men from Ntsimbini. Houses are burnt down and destroyed. There are no reports of injuries or direct attacks against Ntsimbini residents.

Two men are necklaced by unknown vigilantes in the aftermath of a series of sexual attacks against female residents. The necklacing victims are said to be related to the suspected perpetrator of the sexual assaults.
A man who allegedly stole R35 at a tavern is killed by a group of residents when he went to apologise for the deed.
Anti-animal cruelty protesters demonstrate outside a circus which uses animals in its shows.
The body of a man is discovered at the Marikana informal settlement in Philippi. He is believed to have been necklaced by the community after he was apparently caught trying to break into a house.
Villagers protest against poor service delivery and block the N2 road with debris and stone cars. The demonstrators were dispersed by police with rubber bullets.
Two suspected witches are killed.
On 5 January 2015, the police apprehended and beat a prominent member of a local vigilante group. The arrested man later died in police custody.

column7: Police Forces of South Africa (1994-); Vigilante Group (South Africa)
column17: A group of vigilantes, along with an off-duty policeman, kill a local resident suspected of stealing car parts.
100 Uitenhage residents march to Port Elizabeths City Hall and demand answers to their earlier calls for a separate sub-council that would focus on the needs of those in both Uitenhage and Despatch.

Pensioners protest about an infestation of rats in their dwelling and threaten to hold a local councilor hostage if the local authorities do not address the problem. No violence or police involvement reported.
Officers for Isidingo Security assault vagrants at the beach for begging, resulting in the death of a homeless man.
Rioters pelt motorists with stones during a service delivery protest. Police are called in to disperse the demonstrators.

A group of residents march to the municipal offices to demand official rights to a disputed piece of land on the outskirts of the Ekurhuleni township. Community leaders siad that many of the demonstrators have been on the waiting list for RDP houses for more than 10 years.
Residents of Mvutshini near Eshowe blocked a road with burning tyres in an apparent service delivery protest .
A group of men kill three individuals accused of witchcraft.
A thousand angry residents clash with police who are guarding individuals suspected of killing a 14-year-old resident. The police fight back the group with stun grenades and rubber bullets.
Residents of Mahwelereng township staged a protest in Mokopane demanding the delivery of water and electricity.
100 angry villagers protested in Mount Ayliff against bail for six men accused of killing a 34-year-old initiate.

Two security guards of Mandela Bay ward councillor Xola Sabani are shot by unidentified individuals. Sabani had received death threats, allegedly from residents upset over the allocation of houses in the area. Both victims survive.
Members of the National Union of Mineworkers down tools and demand that CEO Paul Dunne and four other key managers be removed.
Striking miners damage mine property at Northam Platinums Zondereinde mine in Limpopo.

A man is assassinated by unknown gunmen on 16th January 2015. The killing is part of an ongoing conflict between two ANC factions, one supporting ANC ward 76 councillor Robert Mzobe and the other comprising his opponents, including block committee chairpersons.
Protesters continue to protest and turn back traffic heading for Malamulele as part of an ongoing strike for the creation of a new municipality.
20 striking workers protest outside the municipal buildings in Sasolburg. The demonstration is cut short when the protesters are arrested.
EFF supporters try to occupy and build shacks on private land as part of the land grab protest policy. The attempt is thwarted by the police and the Red Ants militia.
Squatters erect shacks on owned land as part of a land occupation. Their shacks are destroyed by the police, prompting clashes between the squatters and police.
Squatters erect shacks on owned land as part of a land occupation. Their shacks are destroyed by the police, prompting clashes between the squatters and police.
Residents severely beat two suspected burglars. One of the victims was hospitalised.

On 19 January 2019, rioters attacked and looted shops owned by foreign nationals after a teenage resident was shot by a Somali shopkeeper. Immigrants shop owners have defended their properties with arms. [size=no report]
Squatters erect shacks on owned land as part of a land occupation. Their shacks are destroyed by the police, prompting clashes between the squatters and police.
Squatters erect shacks on owned land as part of a land occupation. Their shacks are destroyed by the police, prompting clashes between the squatters and police.
Lecturers at East Cape Midlands College protest over pay and issues surrounding working contracts.

On 20 January 2015, rioters attacked and loot shops owned by foreign nationals after a teenage resident is shot by a Somali shopkeeper. Immigrants shop owners have defended their properties with arms. [size=no report]
On 20 January 2015, residents looted and set foreign-owned shops on fire in Langlaagte, Johannesburg (Gauteng). Two South African nationals were shot during the looting. [size=no report]
Parents picket outside local schools where teachers are accused of engaging in sexual relationships with the students.
Demonstrators in Malamulele stone a police vehicle seriously injuring two policemen. The clash is part of an ongoing strike by residents who are demanding the creation of a new municipality.
A suspected thief is detained by residents and then stoned to death.

Students protested at Wits Universitys main Braamfontein campus, accusing the universities management of marginalising the poor and vulnerable. The issue centres on the shortfall in National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding.
On 21 January 2015, a Malawi shopkeeper was shot and killed inside his shop in the district of Gauteng. Motivation are unknown.
On 21 January 2015, a rioter was fatally shot dead by police while trying to loot a foreign-owned store. [size=no report]
Angry parents occupy a school and lock it in protest of the schools poor state.
A resident is shot dead and a Malawian shopkeeper is killed amid ongoing violence between South African residents and immigrant communities in Soweto.
Residents set up roadblocks and illegal tollgates as part of an ongoing strike for the creation of a new municipality.
Parents picket outside local schools where teachers are accused of engaging in sexual relationships with the students.
Manenberg residents march in protest against a recent spree of gang-related shootings in the area.
Demonstrators protest outside the Kei Mouth Magistrates Court against a recent spate of murders in the area.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; Students (South Africa)
column17: EFF members vandelise the students representative council offices atWits University. The reson for the riot is that ANC Youth League were reportedly squatting in the offices.

On 22 January 2015, rioters attacked and looted shops owned by foreign nationals after a teenage resident was shot by a Somali shopkeeper. Immigrants shop owners have defended their properties with arms. [size=no report]
On 22 January 2015, a bystander was shot and killed during clashes between rioting residents and foreign-born shopkeepers. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2015, rioters attacked and looted shops owned by foreign nationals after a teenage resident was shot by a Somali shopkeeper. Immigrants shop owners have defended their properties with arms. [size=no report]
On 23 January 0215, a child was killed when they were trampled by a group of looters during clashes between rioting residents and foreign-born shopkeepers. [size=no report]
Residents protest over drug-related crime in the Wentworth area.
A Nigerian dies of a reported heart attack while being chased by the police. This causes clashes between police and rioting members of the Nigerian community.

ANC and SACP members and supporters clash with each other, armed with sticks, knobkerries and guns. The clashreportedly stems from tension between Mpumalanga premier David Mbuza and Mathews Phosa, who was speaking at an SACP event.
On 25 January 2015, the looting and destruction of foreign owned shops by residents spread to Alexandra. [size=no report]
On 25 January 2015, the looting and destruction of foreign owned shops by residents spread to Langlaagte. [size=no report]

Over 100 Egyptian protesters gathered outside the Egyptian embassy in Pretoria to express their anguish about the current state of affairs in Egypt and the coup that had overthrown the first democratically elected president Mohamed Mursi.

ANC and SACP members and supporters clash with each other, armed with sticks, knobkerries and guns. The clashreportedly stems from tension between Mpumalanga premier David Mbuza and Mathews Phosa, who was speaking at an SACP event.
A man is stoned to death in a vigilante attack.
An alleged thief is necklaced and killed by angry community residents.
On 26 January 2015, the looting and destruction of foreign owned shops by residents spread to Ekurhuleni. [size=no report]
Rioters burn tyres and blocks roads with stones during a service delivery protest.
On 26 January 2015, foreign-owned shops were looted and set on fire by residents in Alexandra, Johannesburg (Gauteng). [size=no report]

On 26 January 2015, demonstrators set tires and logs on fire in Old Coronation (Mpumalanga), over unemployment at Kusile Power Station then about poor service delivery. The demonstration looted foreign-owned shops, and the group set one shop on fire; the owner was injured and died. [size=no report]
Residents of Uitenhages Tiryville informal settlement fight off a forced removal by the municipality and police.
Residents riot after workers from outside the area are employed for road construction work.
Two men were killed in a fight between rioters and a Somali shop owner as anti-immigrant violence and looting spreads.

Police fire live amunition at rioters. The riot originally started when two groups, each supporting different rivals who both claim to be mayor of Mogalakwena local municipality, booked to use the same venue on the same day. There were no reports of injuries.

Residents from Fort Grey and Bhongweni villages dug trenches across Buffalo Pass road during a service delivery protest. The demonstrations are dispersed by police with rubber bullets. The demonstration stems from Buffalo City Metro officials attempt to disconnect illegal electricity connections.

50 residents of Greenfields in Booysen Park picket outside Port Elizabeth High Court to demand the release of seven community leaders facing charges for a mob justice assault. The protest is supported by the EFF.

column9: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; COPE: Congress of the People
column17: Informal residents clash with police when state forces try to evict them and destroy their shacks. The squatters were supported by the EFF and COPE. The police responded to the disruption with rubber bullets.
Residents stage and land occupation protest. A ward councillors house is damaged during the demonstrations. After the demonstration fails, the rioters start looting from local shops.
ANC protesters demonstrate against the renaming of a motorway in Cape Town after FW De Klerk, an initiative spearheaded by the opposition DA. The protesters are blocked by police.
Residents of Govan Mbeki township in Dutywa in the Eastern Cape protest over poor roads, water and sanitation
A number of Sekobeng residents riot after a number of them are not hired to work on the upgrade of the waste water treatment works.

Residents from Fort Grey and Bhongweni villages dug trenches across Buffalo Pass road during a service delivery protest. The demonstrations are dispersed by police with rubber bullets. The demonstration stems from Buffalo City Metro officials attempt to disconnect illegal electricity connections.
Parents protest outside a school which they accuse of having insufficient resources to teach their children.
Residents stage and land occupation protest. A ward councillors house is damaged during the demonstrations. After the demonstration fails, the rioters start looting from local shops.
On 29 January 2015, three foreign nationals were shot and injured, and their shops looted by armed individuals in Nsuze (KwaZulu-Natal). The attack was labelled as a xenophobic attack.
Residents blockade roads as part of an ongoing strike for the creation of a new municipality.
Informal residents and members of the EFF clash with police when state forces try to evict them and destroy their shacks.
A youth is killed in a clash between looters and Somalian shop keepers.
Taxi drivers march in protest against Uber cab drivers working without permits and ""pirating"" in the industry.

Residents from Fort Grey and Bhongweni villages dug trenches across Buffalo Pass road during a service delivery protest. The demonstrations are dispersed by police with rubber bullets. The demonstration stems from Buffalo City Metro officials attempt to disconnect illegal electricity connections.

Employees down tools and block reinstated cooperative governance and traditional affairs administration head Stanley Khanyile from entering his place of work. During an altercation, Khanyiles body guard pepper sprays the demonstrators.
Disgruntled SACP members sympathising with the now disbanded regional leadership protest outside a Joe Slovo memorial lecture, saying they do not recognise the interim leadership structure.
Demonstrators barricade roads and clash with police as part of an on-going campaign by Malamuele residents to get their own municipality. Police respond with rubber bullets.
Demonstrators protest outside Woolworths. The demonstration is part of the #BoycottWoolworths campaign related to the chains use of Israeli products
Police fire rubber bullets at demonstrators attempting to occupy vacant land. The squatters throw stones at police and attempt to block the roads with debris.
Animal rights protesters are attacked by security guards while picketing a circus. The guards alleged that the demonstrators started throwing stones.
About 100 people tried to occupy vacant land in Deipsloot. Some of the demonstrators barricaded the road with tyres and clashed with police.

Students at Walter Sisulu Univeristy protest after reaching an impasse with management. The students demand the registration of first year students and continuing students who qualify for National Student Financial Aid Scheme funds without these students paying the minimum initial payment.
Bus drivers vacate their vehicles, barricading the road, and protest outside the offices of the Johannesburg Roads Agency. The police disperse the drivers.
Majakane residents riot over water and electricity supply and burn a tourist bus.
A group of squatters severely injure a security guard manager with knives during a protest over the demolition of their illegally built shacks.
Demonstrators burn a school as part of an on-going protest by Malamuele residents to get their own municipality. Police respond with rubber bullets.
Hundreds of civil servants protest against the return of superintendent-general Stanley Khanyile.
parents picket a schools field to protest the shortage of teachers.
Students at the FET college in East London clash with police and throw fire-bombs during against the institutions management.
Community members beat a man to death after he kills a local woman.
Majakane residents riot over water and electricity supply and barricaded roads, burnt tyres and set alight three trucks.
Three schools are torched as part of an on-going protest by Malamuele residents to get their own municipality. The schools were located in rural areas outside of Mamamulele.
Rioters burn down a school. The demonstration is believed to be related to the on-going protests in Malamulele.
Majakane residents throw stones at a mediator and clash with police during an on-going service delivery protest over water and power.
On 4 February 2015, a service delivery demonstration results in the looting of foreign-owned shops. No casualties reported. [size=no report]

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; SACP: South African Communist Party
column17: On 4 February 2015, a service delivery demonstration organised by the EFF resulted in the looting of foreign-owned shops. Police dispersed the looters. [size=no report]
Students protest about the National Student Financial Aid Scheme.
Two Ethiopian migrants are shot dead by armed men in an attack reportedly motivated by xenophobia.
The DA spearheads a protest outside the headquarters of South Africas power utility Eskom in Johannesburg to demand an end to the companies monopoly of electricity supply.

column7: SAFCEI: Southern African Faith Communities Environment Initiative
column17: Faith community leaders hold a demonstration outside Parliament in protest against the governments proposed nuclear expansion programme. The protest is organised by the Southern African Faith Communities Environment Initiative.

column9: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
column17: Nine workers are injured when a fight breaks out between members of two rival unions. The fight between members of the Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union (Amcu) and the National Union of Mineworkers (NUM) broke while Amcu officials were meeting the companies management to sign a recognition agreement.
Students protest demanding funding for textbooks, transport allowances, and accommodation at school residences and hostels. Some of the demonstrators throw petrol-bombs during the protest.

Students at Walter Sisulu Univeristy protest after reaching an impasse with management. The students demand the registration of first year students and continuing students who qualify for National Student Financial Aid Scheme funds without these students paying the minimum initial payment. Exact date unknown, article printed 5/02/2015.
Demonstrators burn municipal buildings and schools as part of an on-going protest by Malamuele residents to get their own municipality. Police respond with rubber bullets.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: MyCiti buses are stoned by demonstrators. The damaging of vehicles is allegedly related to the labour dispute between Satawu and the bus operating company, Transpeninsula.
Students clash with security and chase security guards from the campus. The students are demanding funding from the National Student Financial Aid Scheme.
Residents barricade the roads in a protest against poor service delivery and blackouts.
A group called Peoples Choice protests outside the trial of two people accused of infanticide, calling for the two accused to rot in jail.
Demonstrators block the road with burning debris to protest against the lack of proper roads.

On 6 February 2015, demonstrators barricade the road and loot foreign-owned shops. The action was sparked by the arrest of the chairperson of the Concerned Youth Group who was denied bail in the local magistrates court. No reports of injuries from the lootings. [size=no report]
Twi MyCiti buses are set alight with molotov cocktails by unknown individuals. The arson attacks come in the wake of a strike by bus drivers are employed by Transpeninsula.
Residents march to demand action after the sexual assault and murder of a local child.

Kouga residents march to the Kuga municipal building to compain about servie delivery and blackouts. The municipal manager shoved one of the protesters leading to a brief scuffle which is quickly broken up by a security guard.
A man accused of stealing is lynched and killed by community members.
Plettenberg Bay residents stage a march to demand the review of a law regarding bail for alleged paedophiles.
A black resident of Alberton is severely beaten and racially abused by a group of Community Police after reprimanding a local youth.

Residents of Siqalo informal settlement blockade the road with burning rubble. Police use stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. The protest stems from the allocation of cleaning contracts in the area

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: MyCiti buses are stoned by demonstrators. The damaging of vehicles is allegedly related to the labour dispute between Satawu and the bus operating company, Transpeninsula.
Protesters burn debris during a service delivery riot. The demonstrators have been waiting for water for over a year.
Students riot of the lack of teachers in Khayelitsha schools. Some school property is set alight by the students during the protest.
Residents demanding to be employed by a local mining company operating in the local area riot and clash with the police. Community members burn down a tribal court building.
Residents demonstrate and block the roads with burning debris to protest against the lack of services in the area.
Durban University of Technology (DUT) students take to the streets to protest against perceived failures in the financial aid bureaucracy.

column7: COSAS: Congress of South African Students
column17: Thousands of schoolchildren take part in the march in solidarity with Malamulele pupils who have been barred from attending school due to protest action in their locality. There are reports of looting during the march. Members of COSAS reportedly engaged in looting during the demonstration.
Students at the Tshwane University of Technology march to demand a response from management regarding the funding shortage.
Walter Sisulu University students march over the issue of securing funding for studies.
Students at two of the University of KwaZulu-Natals campuses protest over the issue of securing funding for studies.
Students at two of the University of KwaZulu-Natals campuses protest over the issue of securing funding for studies.

EE members march to the headquarters of the Public Investment Company to demand that it disinvest from the Curro Holdings as public education is being starved of funds that are diverted to private education

Residents of Siqalo informal settlement blockade the road with burning rubble. Police use stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. The protest stems from the allocation of cleaning contracts in the area
Demonstrators protest against the dismissal of a local teacher accused of sexual misconduct.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: MyCiti buses are stoned by demonstrators. The damaging of vehicles is allegedly related to the labour dispute between Satawu and the bus operating company, Transpeninsula.
Students clash with police at Fox Cox Agricultural College. The students were demonstrating over dilapidated infrastructure and increasing fees.
Demonstrators protest and burn debris to protest against the dismissal of a local teacher accused of sexual misconduct.
Community members burn down the house of a suspected murderer. The suspect and his family escaped the mob without injury.
Students demonstrate over the issue of financial aid and clash violently with police.
Police fire rubber bullets at students demonstrating over financial aid opportunities.

Students at the Tshwane University of Technology fight running battles with security guards over the issue of financial exclusion and the payment of financial support for poorer students. The security guards attempt to disperse the students with teargas.
Protests by Tshwane University of Technology students spread to other TUT campuses.
Rival EFF factions engage is a clash during a press conference headed by Andile Mngxitama, an EFF member who opposes EFF leader Malema.
Students burn debris and rubbish while protesting about issues of financial aid and funding. The police are present but do not directly engage with the students.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; DA: Democratic Alliance
column17: EFF MPs protest in parliament during the State of the Nation address. The MPs engage in fist-fights with police, who eject the Mps from the building. Police clash with DA supporters outside parliament before the address starts. Notable DA figures including Cape Metro regional chairman Shaun August and national spokesman Marius Redelinghuys are arrested.
Protests by Tshwane University of Technology students spread to other TUT campuses.
Protests by Tshwane University of Technology students spread to other TUT campuses.
Residents block roads and burn debris. The reason for the protest is unknown.
Students stage a protest over funding. Opportunities. Some of the demonstrators are arrested for public violence.

column7: SAJBD: South African Jewish Board of Deputies
column17: Protesters demonstrate against a tour by Leila Khaled, a Palestinian activist accused of being complicit in acts of violence against Israeli targets.
Emalahleni campus is shut down due to student protests at TUT over insufficient funding.
Wynberg and Plumstead residents protest to stop the city from levelling the last of four houses to make way for a new MyCiTi bus route
The City of Cape Towns Law Enforcement evict land occupiers near Gugulethu and demolish six shacks sparking violent clashes between squatters and police.

Parents and pupils of Reynopark High School protest outside the premises calling for the dismissal of the principal in the after a number of incidents of misconduct by teachers involving racial abuse, drug use and excessive corporal punishment.
The leader of the EFF faction calling for Julius Malemas removal is attacked and his house looted by EFF members.
EFF members are attacked by individuals wearing ANC regalia. The attack results in pregnant EFF ward committee member and two others being hospitalised.
Staff members at Mozolo FM protest over the non-payment of salaries.

A man is assassinated by unknown gunmen on 15th January 2015. The killing is part of an ongoing conflict between two ANC factions, one supporting ANC ward 76 councillor Robert Mzobe and the other comprising his opponents, including block committee chairpersons.
Teachers at East Cape Midlands College protest and demand that their salaries be increased and that temporary staff be made permanent.
Residents blockade schools in protest over the lack of water and other services.
Residents burn tyres due to their unhappiness with the ""unfair"" allocation of RDP houses .

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: Government employees protest outside the office of the premier in Bhiso over the lack of growth in their salaries.
Traffic policemen protest and demand R52-million in salary arrears dating back to 2006.
Depatch residents burn tyres and demand to be allocated RDP houses.

Students are invited to submit a memorandum to end the recent protests at the Cape Peninsula University of Technology. The demonstrators are met by police and university security sparking clashes. The police fire rubber bullets to disperse the students.
Teachers at East Cape Midlands College protest and demand that their salaries be increased and that temporary staff be made permanent.
Demonstrators protest outside the trial of individuals accused of murdering a child.
Depatch residents burn tyres and demand to be allocated RDP houses.

Protesters demonstrate over the lack of housing opportunities and demanding that the city allocate houses to them in ongoing projects in the area. The protesters blocked traffic for hours and burnt vehicles before police and law enforcement officials dispersed them by firing rubber bullets.
A school is burnt down during ongoing protests in Malamulele by residents for their own separate municipality.
Parents at a high school in Alexandria shut pupils and teachers out in protest against teacher shortages dating back to 2010.
Protesters demonstrate outside Mthatha Magistrates Court and call for bail to be denied to Melice Jacobs, arrested in connection with the discovery of frozen baby bodies.

Students at Cape Peninsula University of Technology demonstrate over a policy which bars students from registering if they have outstanding debts. Two groups of students, one black the other white, clash after about 300 protesting students blockaded both main gates of the university and stopped vehicles from passing through.
Parents protest outside a school calling for the resignation of the principle in the aftermath of allegations of racial discrimination.

Students at Cape Peninsula University of Technology demonstrate over a policy which bars students from registering if they have outstanding debts. Protester block roads to prevent cars from leaving the campus.
Malabar Extension 6 residents protest against the relocation of evictees from Parsonsvlei to the local area.
The president of the South Africa based pro-Mnangagwa Zimbabwe Star Movement, Robert Gwarazimba, is stabbed by unidentified Zimbabwean assailants. The attack is assumed to be politically motivated.
The ANC leads a march to the Western Cape legislature in a campaign against racism and the socioeconomic exclusion of the majority in the province.
Two groups of protesting parents at a primary school in Roodepoort protest are kept separate by police. The two groups disagree over the appointment of the new principle.
Students at Cape Peninsula University of Technology demonstrate over a policy which bars students from registering if they have outstanding debts.
The monarch of the Khoikhoi people leads a peaceful march to protest against the marginalisation faced by Khoisan people in democratic South Africa.
The National Union of Mineworkers protests outside Glencores Middleburg offices against potential job losses.
Hundreds of Eersterust community members march and protest against drug abuse and drug dealers.
Demonstrators block roads with boulders and burning debris during a service delivery protest. The police arrest a number of rioters
Residents destroy shops and property owned by Somalians after the phone of a murder victim in found in a Somali-owned phoneshop.
Residents destroy shops and property owned by Somalians after the phone of a murder victim in found in a Somali-owned phoneshop.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union; Teachers (South Africa); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: NEHAWU members engage in a strike and barricade the entrance to the Rubusana district education office in Mdantsane. The strikers grievances include special school employees not being paid overtime, inconsistent salary grading and bursaries not available for staff at district level.
A group of Walmer Township residents protest outside the Port Elizabeth Magistrates Court during the trial of two SMME owners accused of public violence.
Demonstrators block roads with boulders and burning debris during a service delivery protest. The police are present but do not interact with the demonstrators.
An unidentified group fires upon Minister of Tourism, Derek Hanekom, and engage in a firefight with the ministers bodyguards.
On 23 February 2015, a service delivery demonstration turns violent with foreign shops being looted. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets. [size=no report]

The EFF and the ANC demonstrate outside the Gauteng legislature following Premier David Makhuras State of the Province address. The two protesting groups do not engage in violence and are kept separate by the police.
Service-delivery rioters erect barricades on the road and pelt passing cars with stones. The demonstration leaves officials travelling between South Africa and Lesotho stranded.

Thousands of demonstrators march to the African National Congresss KwaZulu-Natal headquarters in Durban over the outcome of the parties eThekwinis elective conference. The march was reportedly triggered by reports of a letter giving reasons why the result of the conference should be nullified
Students protest demanding the promotion of all pupils who failed last year and the re-admission of all students who were suspended last year. Students burn debris during their protest.

Members of the Seskhona Peoples Rights Movement protest outside Bellville court during the trial of a number of Seskhona activists. The demonstrators reportedly clash with police and throw stones at Somali residents.
Shack-dwellers demonstrate against eviction by the council by burning debris and erecting barricades.
Demonstrators damage roads. The cause of the protest is unknown.
On 24 February 2015, a service delivery demonstration turns violent with foreign shops being looted. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets. [size=no report]

On 24 February 2015, members of the Seskhona Peoples Rights Movement continue to riot in Philippi and loot foreign-owned shops, resulting in clashes with armed shopkeepers. Two people are shot dead during the clashes. [size=no report]
Service-delivery rioters erect barricades on the road and pelt passing cars with stones. The demonstration leaves officials travelling between South Africa and Lesotho stranded.

On 24 February 2015, residents stoned and vandalized a building housing foreign nationals and a Islamic education institution in Laudium (Gauteng) after a boy was found mutilated in the area. The group accused foreign nationals of being responsible for the killing. [size=no report]
Parents and pupils from Tsholomnqa High School block the road with debbris and protest over a lack of scholar transport.
50 protesters block the road with rubbish bins. The demonstrators claimed that they were being sidelined from housing-project contracts by municipal authorities.
Cape Peninsula University of Technology students protest over the allocation of student accommodation.
Demonstrators block roads with boulders and burning debris. The riot was due to the municipality cutting illegal electricity connections in the area.
Service-delivery rioters erect barricades on the road and pelt passing cars with stones. The demonstration leaves officials travelling between South Africa and Lesotho stranded.

On 25 February 2015, members of the Seskhona Peoples Rights Movement continue to riot in Philippi and loot foreign-owned shops, resulting in clashes with armed shopkeepers. Two people are shot dead during the clashes. [size=no report]
Shack-dwellers demonstrate against their eviction by the council and violently clash with the police.
Residents of Makana municipality protest outside Grahamstown City Hall, asking for the municipal councillors contract to be extended.

Students protest demanding the promotion of all pupils who failed last year and the re-admission of all students who were suspended last year. The police disperse the protests with rubber bullets. No reported injuries.
A teenage boy is shot dead during clashes between rioters and police. The rioters were demanding that the Bushbuckridge local municipality provide them with water.

On 26 February 2015, a foreign shopkeeper was injured after a mob threw a petrol bomb inside his shop in Bramfisherville, Soweto (Gauteng). Several attacks on foreign-owned shops were registered in Emdeni, Zola, Naledi, and Bramfisherville after the death of a teenager, allegedly by a Somali national. At least 68 people were arrested. [size=at least 68]

On 26 February 2015, foreign nationals threw stones at South Africa nationals and shot to the air in Dornkop, Johannesburg (Gauteng) as a group was gathered to discuss the closure of foreign-owned shops in Orlando East. [size=no report]
Service-delivery rioters erect barricades on the road and pelt passing cars with stones. The demonstration leaves officials travelling between South Africa and Lesotho stranded.
Lenesia residents clash with Thembelihle residents after Thembelihle residents try to destroy electricity boxes in Lenesia. Two people are shot. One of the victims later dies in hospital.
Residents protest and erect barricades and demand employment at the mines and that a new tarred road be built by the mining companies.
A group of angry residents chase armed police after a policeman reportedly shoots a local youth.
Demonstrators erect barricades on the motorway. The reason for the protest is unknown.
A youth is shot dead after police try to disperse a crowd of spectators watching a drag race. The crowd clashed with the police who fired shots in response.
Khoisan protesters embark on a Liberation Walk to demand more legal protection for their culture and an apology from Bantu and European South Africans for past injustices.
Gay and lesbian activists protest and accuse Cape Town Pride of being racist and exclusionary.
Three individuals accused of terrorising the local area are stoned to death by angry community members.

On 1 March 2015, rioters looted foreign-owned businesses after a foreign shop owner was found in possession of a mobile phone belonging to a local man who was killed three weeks ago. No reports of injuries. [size=no report]

Nelson Mandela Bay treasury and budget employees protest over involve wages, grading levels imbalances, contract workers not being given permanent employment due to outsourcing and the use of labour brokers.
Residents riot after their illegal electricity connections are cut. Police disperse the demonstration with rubber bullets.
Residents set two truckers alight during a service delivery protest. The protest concerns unfullfilled promoises of a paved road. The rioters are dispersed by the police with rubber bullets.

Students protest outside the ministry of higher education and attempt to hand over a memorandum demanding free education for poorer students and a disbandment of the National Student Financial Aid Scheme.
Residents burn debris to protest against the decision to merge Umjindi local municipality with Mbombela. Police disperse the riot with rubber bullets.

column7: ABMSM: Abahlali Basemjondolo Shack Dwellers Movement
column17: Protesters demonstrate outside the trial of two ANC councillers and an alleged hitman accused of murdering Abahlali Basemjondolo actvist Thuli Ndlovu in September 2014.
Community members burn and destroy the property of a suspected murderer.
Land invaders clash with police who try to demolish their shacks. Police disperse the demonstrators with rubber bullets.

Students protest outside the ministry of higher education and attempt to hand over a memorandum demanding free education for poorer students and a disbandment of the National Student Financial Aid Scheme.
A man suspected of committing a murder and sexual assault is beaten to death by residents.
The United Front march to the Gauteng legislature to protest against the budget which they accuse of catering to capitalist interests..
The Democratic Alliance lead a protest against E-tolls outside Gauteng premier David Makhuras office.
Residents clash with police after the authorities drop the charges against a murder suspect.

Police use stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse a group of protesters burning tyres. The residents were demonstrating against the demolition of homes without temporary accommodation being provided.
A woman accused of poisoning a resident is beaten and lynched by the community. The victim is saved before the community can kill her.
Hundreds of small and medium-business owners storm the council chambers and hold councillors and officials hostage, and demand to know when they would benefit from municipal tender
Residents burn tyres and blockade roads in a protest over poor service delivery and water provision. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets and stun grenades.
Walmer township residents protest at the Walmer police station about the escalating crime

300 pupils from Philippi Secondary School protest outside the provincial education department to demand a brick school be constructed in their area. Police respond with rubber bullets and stun grenades. There are reports of minor injuries.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.
Residents riot after being refused permission to march to Westonaria municipal offices.
Over 500 Stellenbosch University students attended the ""Reaffirming Human Dignity March"" to protest against student discrimination in the town, following an alleged racist attack of three students.
5 men accused of killing a resident during a bar fight are necklaced. Two later die from their injuries.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.
Residents riot after being refused permission to march to Westonaria municipal offices.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.
An anti-Israeli protest march took place as part of Israeli Apartheid Week.

ANC members assault two Mhlontlo municipality ward councillors. The violence broke out when the branch was meant to nominate a candidate for the upcoming by-election in ward 21 after councillor Mkhuseli Mathe was fired.

Over 60 community members from Vaalbos, outside Barkly West, took to the Northern Cape High Court to file an application requesting access to all records and financial statements relating to diamond mining activity on the farm. The community members stage a demonstration against illegal miners.
Friends and relatives of slain teenager Tracy-Lee Anthony gather outside Wynberg Magistrates Court to protest against gangsterism and violence.
Residents engage in a violent protest after rumour circulates about the alleged abduction and killing of a child. The rumour is later shown to be a hoax.
Residents occupy the local clinic and protest against aging infrastructure, poor service and insufficient staffing.

column7: Students (South Africa); NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: Police disperse rioting students and staff members at Eastcape Midlands College campus. Staff have been striking over salaries for the past eight weeks.
Residents riot and burn down the property of an alleged murderer.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.
Protesters dump feces on a statue of Cecil Rhodes in the University of Cape Town. Some of the protesters allegedly assault security staff attempting to stop the protest.
Taxi drivers and motorists demonstrate over potholed roads. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.
Taxi drivers and motorists demonstrate over potholed roads. A policeman is injured by gunfire from the crowd and the police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

500 workers at timber manufacturer Merensky Sawmill burn wooden logs to block the R412 and demand a minimum of R6670 a month, better conditions, medical aid and compensation for deaths and workplace injuries.
Parents occupy and bar the entrance to a school, protesting against missing funds and unprofessional financial reporting by school management team.
Scores of residents protested outside the Khayelitsha Magistrates Court during the trial of a man accused of murdering a five-year-old girl.
Residents of eastern Gauteng townships of Ivory Park, Ebony Park, Tembisa and Midrand march to call for the release of six men jailed for the murder of an alleged nyaope addict.

Members of South African Municipal Workers Union (Samwu) and Independent Municipal and Allied Trade Union (Imatu) members protest in front of the municipal building over the lack of resources, safety equipment or protective clothing.
A group of 15 people who have been receiving disability grants for at least five years protest outside the Heideveld Community Day Centre after their latest applications were declined.
Parents occupy and bar the entrance to a school, protesting against missing funds and unprofessional financial reporting by school management team.
Residents from Ezigodweni location in the Needs Camp area barricade the Mount Coke road northwest of East London in a protest against the lack of services.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union; Teachers (South Africa); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: The offices of the deputy head of Eastcape Midlands College are set alight by rioters. Staff have been on strike at the college for eight weeks.
Residents of Ga-Sekororo blockade the village with rocks and debris to protest against the municipal merger of their village with two neighbouring municipalites.
Protesters demonstrate outside the trial of a woman accused of murdering a local hip-hop artist. The protesters threaten the accused by there are no reports of injuries or damage to property.
MTN employees protest after find out that their bonuses have been cancelled due to underperformance.
A vigilante mob beats a suspected mugger to death.
Parents protest outside a school over the forced removal of the principal for alleged poor performance.
Thembelihle residents protest in Lenasia over housing issues. The demonstrators block the road and stone vehicles.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: More than 100 employees at a car dealership and members of NUMSA down tools demanding an immediate resignation of the management. Company property has been damaged during the demonstration.
Students continue to protest over the presence of a statue of Cecil Rhodes on the UCT campus.
300 women in a woman-only hostel demonstrate against the admittance of children to the hostel.
Pupils and parents at Hendrick Kanise Combined school in Alicedale burn tyres in protest at a shortage of teachers at the school.

column7: SADSAWU: Domestic Service and Allied Workers Union
column17: Domestic workers from the South African Domestic Service and Allied Workers Union hold a peaceful protest outside Parliament demanding increased wages and better injury compensation.
Soweto residents riot over service delivery and the installation of green boxes by Eskom. The police disperse the riot.
A Zimbabwean woman is burnt alive after being accused of using witchcraft to kill a local child.
The EFF and shack dwellers attempt to occupy a parcel of vacant land. The occupiers clash with police and armed ANC members assault EFF members with sjamboks and rocks.
Taxi drivers riot, clash with police and burn police vehicles after a police operation against taxi-related violence.
Students of Philippi High School protest in Cape Town city centre over the lack of promised renovations to their school. The police disperse the protesters leading to serious injuries.

column16: Institute for Security Studies; Cape Times; Xenowatch
column17: On 14 March 2015, about 200 residents looted foreign-owned shops in Stella (North-West), after the police raided a tavern and seized the alcohol. 13 people were arrested. [size=about 200]
Sunnyside community members, the ANCs ward 92 leaders, anti-drug and youth organisations march against drugs and prostitution in the area.

On 15 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

On 15 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

Church members march against the increasing cases of abuse against women and children in the area.
Soweto-on-Sea residents march to the Port Elizabeth City Hall to express their frustration over the governments failure to deliver decent houses.
Soweto residents block the road and pelt passing cars with stones, demanding electricity.
Staff members at the University of Mpumalanga burn tyres and use rocks to blockade the gate of the Hospitality and Tourism Academy during a strike over ""unpaid December bonuses"".

100 landless squatters engage in a stand-off with police and protest against the demolition of their shacks. The squatters recently invaded and illegally erected structures on the municipally-owned land.

On 16 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

Students at Waterberg FET college protest over lack of textbooks, lecturers and other issues. The police allegedly respond in a heavy-handed manner and disperse and beat the demonstrating students. No serious injuries reported.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU members and municipal workers riot after discovering that money deducted from their salaries each month had not been paid to their pension funds, medical aids and other third parties.
Police disperse rioters with Lenasia with rubber bullets. The riot is reportedly related to service delivery.
Pupils holding placards reading ""Boycott Woolworth"" and ""Israel is the devil"" loot a Woolworths causing extensive damage.

On 17 March 2015, angry residents loot foreign-owned shops and burn debris after the Red Ant Security and Eviction Services cut off electricity that was illegally connected in some of the houses. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]
On 17 March 2015, an unidentified group of foreign-nationals killed a man they accuse of looting their shops. [size=no report]
Residents of Jeppestown in central Johannesburg protest after finding out that the buildings they occupy have been purchased and that they will be evicted.
Parents chase away teachers and burn rubble during a protest over the dismissal of the principal.
Students at the University of Cape Town protest demanding that the statue of Cecil Rhodes be removed from university property.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU members and municipal workers riot after discovering that money deducted from their salaries each month had not been paid to their pension funds, medical aids and other third parties.

Parents demonstrate against the dismissal of a principal accused of sexual misconduct. The parents attack teachers accused of conspiring against the principal and throw one on a fire. No reported deaths.

On 18 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

On 18 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]

On 18 March 2015, demonstrators burn municipal buildings and clash with police during an ongoing service delivery demonstration against insufficient municipal water provision. Foreign-owned shops are looted during the riots. [size=no report]
Booysen Park residents protest in Bethelsdorp against the slow pace of house building and threaten to close down projects to build new homes.
Rioting students Acornhoek College demand to be accommodated at the college and demand financial aid for their studies. The police disperse the crowd and arrest the ringleaders.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: NEHAWU members protest against excessive security expenditure and the installation of 200 security cameras and fencing.

Residents of Jeppestown in central Johannesburg throw stones at police after finding out that the buildings they occupy have been purchased and that they will be evicted. The police disperse the riot with rubber bullets.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Strikers at the Jonhannesburg Roads Agency, affiliated with SAMWU, beat non-striking workers with sticks.
Residents burn down the property of their counciller during a service delivery protest over water provision.

Students at the University of Cape Town protest demanding that the statue of Cecil Rhodes be removed from university property. At the same time 200 women farmworkers march from to Parliament to protest against land evictions and low wages.
Protesters demonstrate outside the department of energy against the expansion of nuclear energy.
Students at the University of Cape Town protest demanding that the statue of Cecil Rhodes be removed from university property.

ANC officials marching under the banner of the parties ""Stop Racism Campaign"" in Worcester. The demonstrators were protesting against a pass system which has been accused of reintroducing Apartheid-era pass laws.
Parents and pupils at Embekweni Primary School protest against the lack of scholar transport in the area.
Teachers and pupils staged a sit-in at the provincial education headquarters in Zwelitsha protesting against the lack of functioning toilets at their school.
A clinic is burnt down and water taps destoyred by service-delivery protesters.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Strikers at the Jonhannesburg Roads Agency, affiliated with SAMWU, beat non-striking workers with sjamboks.

Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus. Simultaneously 500 women from across the country march to the Western Cape provincial legislature offices to hand over a memorandum with their demands for more land rights and access to other productive resources to address food security.
Animal rights protesters demonstrate outside Lion Park over the parks use of mature lions for canned hunting.
The EFF hold a march to remember those who died during the Sharpville Killing.
A man accused of stealing is killed by community members.
Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus.

On 22 March 2015, Somali, Ethiopian and Pakistani nationals were attacked by a mob in KwaMashu (eThekwini) during a xenophobic attack. It was not reported whether the victims were injured. At least 28 people were arrested. [size=at least 28]
A meeting to elect a new ANC branch leader turns violent when two factions turn up with their candidates, leading to clashes and broken property.
Thousands of Home Affairs employees hold picketts across the country to demonstrate against the changing of their working hours.
Mineworkers outside Northam Platinums flagship Zondereinde mine and call for Northam CEO to step down. The political affiliation of the mineworkers is not known.

Residents of Plastic View, an informal settlement in Pretoria east, protesting outside the North Gauteng High Court in Pretoria to demand the construction of new low- cost houses. The land they currently occupy is due to be sold off.
Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus.
Service delivery protesters riot Alicedale, destroying two municipal buildings and damaging a state vehicle.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU members engage in an illegal march against the lack of equipment and financial mismanagement at their work and damage municipal property and throw faeces at the government buildings. The demonstrators are dispersed with stun grenades and rubber bullets.
The Social Justice Coalition leads a march against xenophobia in Khayelitsha.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: A protest by some 7 000 Numsa members shuts down Medupi power station. The protesters demand the extension of completion bonuses beyond senior managers and an end to retrenchments and evictions from subsidised accommodation
A smaller crowd protest against animal cruelty outside a circus using live animal acts.
Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus.
Rioters burn municipal property and demand that Mayor Sello Ntsepe and his entire committee step down. The rioters are dispersed by riot police.
Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus.
A small crowd protest against animal cruelty outside a circus using live animal acts.

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: COSATU leads a protest with tea estate workers who claim to have not been paid in 9 months.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: A protest by some 7 000 Numsa members shuts down Medupi power station. The protesters demand the extension of completion bonuses beyond senior managers and an end to retrenchments and evictions from subsidised accommodation
An elderly woman and her son are attacked by a mob after being suspected of being complicit in the disappearance of a 5-year-old girl.
The statue of George V is defaced by students at the University of KwaZulu-Natal.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: A protest by some 7 000 Numsa members shuts down Medupi power station. The protesters demand the extension of completion bonuses beyond senior managers and an end to retrenchments and evictions from subsidised accommodation

On 26 March 2015, a mob chased foreigners who owned shops in KwaMashu (eThekwini) out of the area. The group were ordering the foreign nationals to return to their own home countries. [size=no report]
Protesters with the Ses'khona People's Rights Movement looted stalls in Cape Town CBD after protesting in front of the Western Cape legislature. The rioters are dispersed by police.
Students continue to occupy buildings in the University of Cape Town to protest against the statue of Cecil Rhodes on UCT campus.

Residents protest outside the opening of a new mall in Langa. Protesters demanded that the malls project steering committee (PSC) members, whom they accused of being corrupt, withdraw so that an election of new members could take place. The protest was organised by activist group Sivukile Sonele.

workers, supported by the SACP, march to the municipal offices of Vhembe district municipality and threatened to occupy the offices and remove mayor Tshitereke Matibe. The demonstrators accuse accused Matibe and his colleagues of mismanaging the municipality.
