Soshanguve residents march to celebrate the lives of the townships fallen heroes and heroines of the anti-apartheid struggle. The march is also held to commemorate the anniversary of the Winterveldt killing.
A woman accused of witchcraft is attacked and seriously injured by community members.

On 30 March 2015, demonstrators stoned and burnt foreign-owned shops in Isipingo (KwaZulu-Natal). The attacks occurred after the Zulu king Goodwill Zwelithini made negative remarks about the presence of foreign nationals in KwaZulu-Natal. Hundreds of foreign nationals sought refuge in the police station. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities. [size=no report]

Around 250 pensioners and previous Transnet employees march to demand that their circumstances be immediately and decisively improved. The demonstrators accuse the government of embezzeling pension funds.
Protesters demonstrate outside the trial of local health workers who demonstrated in 2014 over the state of the health system and working conditions.
The traditional chief of the Mhwaduba is shot dead in an attack linked to a disputed piece of land. The chief was armed at the time of his shooting.
Informal settlement residents barricade roads in Durban and demand ""promised"" free houses.
Orlando residents protest against the installation of prepaid water meters. The demonstrators destroy multiple water metres during their protest.
On 1 April 2015, a Zimbabwean national was attacked by a mob in Chatsworth (KwaZulu-Natal). It was not reported whether he was injured or killed. [size=no report]
On 1 April 2015, a Mozambican national was killed by a mob in Verulam (KwaZulu-Natal). [size=no report]

On 1 April 2015, residents riot and kill a foreign national after a local resident is allegedly shot dead by a Somali national during a dispute. Foreign-owned shops are also looted during the violence. [size=no report]

Equal Education lead a sit-in in protest at the delayed release of the provincial implementation plans for Norms and Standards for School Infrastructure. The protesters are demanding an improvement in school infrastructure. The protest is held outside parliament and King Williams Town education department.

Equal Education lead a sit-in in protest at the delayed release of the provincial implementation plans for Norms and Standards for School Infrastructure. The protesters are demanding an improvement in school infrastructure. The protest is held outside parliament and King Williams Town education department. Simultaneously, dismissed South African Social Security Agency workers marched to the organisations Capet Town offices and demand to be reinstated as they claim they were unfairly dismissed.
The DA and members of the public march to the deparment of public enterprises to protest against a proposed 25% increase in Eskoms charges.

200 villagers halted construction on the road to Bumbane Great Place by stoning the trucks. Three people were injured. The residents accused the king of hiring relatives and people from far-flung villages for government projects designed to boost local employment.
On 2 April 2015, a group took to the streets in Durban (KwaZulu-Natal ) demonstrating against the wave of xenophobic attacks in Johannesburg. [size=no report]

Equal Education lead a sit-in in protest at the delayed release of the provincial implementation plans for Norms and Standards for School Infrastructure. The protesters are demanding an improvement in school infrastructure. The protest is held outside parliament and King Williams Town education department.

Equal Education lead a sit-in in protest at the delayed release of the provincial implementation plans for Norms and Standards for School Infrastructure. The protesters are demanding an improvement in school infrastructure. The protest is held outside parliament and King Williams Town education department.
Langa residents protest over what they say are unfair hiring practices at the new R60 million Langa Junction Mall.
Members of the EFF set alight to a British War memorial as part of a nationwide protest against the presence of colonial statues across South Africa.
A ex-block committee member is killed by unknown assailants at Glebelands Hostel. The man had been purged from the organisation the year before.

A man is assassinated by unknown gunmen on the 2nd of April 2015. The killing is part of an ongoing conflict between two ANC factions, one supporting ANC ward 76 councillor Robert Mzobe and the other comprising his opponents, including block committee chairpersons.

A man is assassinated by unknown gunmen. The killing is part of an ongoing conflict between two ANC factions, one supporting ANC ward 76 councillor Robert Mzobe and the other comprising his opponents, including block committee chairpersons.

column7: SWEAT: Sex Workers Education and Advocacy Taskforce
column17: The Sex Workers Education and Advocacy Taskforce (SWEAT) hold a protest to remember the murder of seven sex workers at Sea Point in 2003.
Armed police disperse residents of Bholotwa village picketing on the road. The protest is over service delivery. No reported injuries.

Around 4 April 2015 (week of), at least 4 people died during a wave of xenophobic attacks in Johannesburg (Gauteng). The attacks came amid accusations that the country's poor economic situation was caused by foreign nationals. [size=no report]

Township residents riot and attack hostel dwellers and burn down part of their residence. The attack happened after a hostel dweller killed a resident in a personal dispute. Many of the hostel residents support the IFP while many of the rioters were allegedly members of the ANC seeking to evict political rivals.
A suspected looter is beaten to death by Mozambican shop owners.
Paul Krugers statue is defaced as part of a nationwide protest against the presence of colonial statues across South Africa.
A march against gang crime is called to a halt after an unknown group shoots at the demonstrators. One of the protest organisers is hit and seriously injured.

40 Zimbabwean and Mozambican nationals from the New Germany Road informal settlement seek refuge at the Sydenham police station after they were allegedly assaulted by angry locals with golf clubs, sticks and crowbars.
Immigrants are shot at by unknown assailants.
A third memorial of the Anglo-Boer war is defaced as part of a nationwide protest against the presence of colonial statues across South Africa. The action was reportedly carried out by the EFF.

On 7 April 2015, police used water cannons and rubber bullets to disperse foreign nationals marching against the recent xenophobic violence in Durban (KwaZulu-Natal). No serious injuries reported. [size=no report]

Residents protest outside the trial of three people suspected to be engaged in a taxi-related feud. The residents protest against the prospect of bail for the suspects and threaten to engage in vigilante action if the suspects are released.
Rioters attack immigrants in Chatsworth as xenophobic violence spreads in KwaZulu-Natal
Violent protests erupt after people who had invaded land near the Kahyelishas Nolugile train station are evicted. The rioters clash with police and attack civilians leading to serious injuries.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: Nehawu members protest outside the education department head offices in Zwelitsha. The protest is to do with the freezing of funds after 13 million Rand is allegedly embezzeled.

Hundreds of workers at Johannesburg paint manufacturer Medal Paints protest outside their employers offices, demanding that the company, along with their respective labour brokerage firms, obey a new law which stipulates that workers who are employed by labour brokers for three months have to be converted into permanent employees when that period lapses.
A group of angry Alicedale residents burn tyres to demonstrate their unhappiness with Makana Municipalitys failure to fix roads and build houses. Police disperse the rioters.
A group of Somali nationals who took part in the anti-xenophobia protest are seriously assaulted on their way back from the demonstration.
Residents and vigilantes burn down the house of a suspected serial killer
The statue of Louis Botha is defaced as part of a nationwide protest against the presence of colonial statues across South Africa.

Villagers riot outside the residence of AbaThembu King Buyelekhaya Dalindyebo. The residents accused the king of hiring relatives and people from far-flung villages for government projects designed to boost local employment. The police are called to maintain order.
Students which are part of the Rhodes Must Fall campaign enter and disrupt a UCT council meeting and start chanting racially-charged slogans such as one settler, one bullet.
Alicedale residents burn down the community hall to demonstrate their unhappiness with Makana Municipalitys failure to fix roads and build houses.
A group of South African Muslims stage a protest in the CBD to show their solidarity with Christian families who lost loved ones in recent attacks by Boko Haram and al-Shabaab.
Squatters, supported by the EFF, riot and loot a mall. The looters clash with security guards at the mall.
Violent protests erupt after people who had invaded land near the Kahyelishas Nolugile train station are evicted. The rioters clash with police and attack civilians leading to serious injuries.

Afrikaaners protest against the removal and defacement of colonial-era statues. The protesters surround the statues of Jan van Riebeeck in Cape Town and Paul Kruger in Pretoria and sing Afrikaaner apartheid-era anthems.

Afrikaaners protest against the removal and defacement of colonial-era statues. The protesters surround the statues of Jan van Riebeeck in Cape Town and Paul Kruger in Pretoria and sing Afrikaaner apartheid-era anthems.
Squatters riots after their dwellings are destroyed by the Red Ants militia. The squatters loot and are dispersed by police.
On 9 April 2015, two Ethiopian shopkeepers were shot and injured in KwaMakhutha (KwaZulu-Natal) during a robbery attempt and suspected xenophobic attack.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress; Students (South Africa)
column17: Students and members of the ANC and EFF destroy the fencing surrounding the statue of Cecil Rhodes and try to push it off the truck transporting the statue off UCT campus.
On 9 April 2015, a by-stander was shot during a gunfight between armed foreign shopkeepers and looters. The victim later died of her wounds. [size=no report]
On 9 April 2015, three foreign nationals were killed and foreign-owned businesses looted in xenophobic attacks in Umlazi. [size=no report]
On 9 April 2015, three foreign nationals were killed by a mob in Umlazi (KwaZulu-Natal) during attacks on foreign-owned shops in the city. [size=no report]

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Dismissed employees at Medupi power plant destroy property and attempt to block workers from entering. The dismissed employees engaged in an illegal strike backed by NUMSA.
Students at Wits University protest over poor housing and hand over a memorandum to Rob Sharman, director of campus housing and residence life at the university.

Pupils and members of prominent NGO Equal Education march to the headquarters of the KwaZulu-Natal Education Department to demand that pupils living in Nquthu, near Dundee, be provided with transport.

EFF members demonstrate outside the High Court, protesting against the courts decision to to prohibit a group of land invaders from reoccupying a piece of land in Khayelitsha from which they were evicted .

On 10 April 2015, residents of Ledig block the road with debris and demand that Disele Phologane, a director at Bakubung Community Development Unit, step down. The demonstrators allege that the councillor misappropriated millions of rands in the form of royalties from a local mine. Foreign-owned properties and shops are reportedly looted by the rioters. [size=no report]
On 10 April 2015, two Ethiopian nationals sustained serious burns after their shop was set on fire by a mob in Umlazi KwaZulu-Natal). One of the victims later died of his wounds. [size=no report]
On 10 April 2015, two Somali nationals sustained serious burns after their shop was petrol-bombed by unknown assailants in Umlazi (KwaZulu-Natal).

column7: ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League; Women (South Africa)
column17: ANCWL members protest against bail for a man accused of killing his girlfriend.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Dismissed employees at Medupi power plant destroy property and attempt to block workers from entering. The dismissed employees engaged in an illegal strike backed by NUMSA.

Two Somalis sustain serious burns after their shop is petrol-bombed by unknown assailants. Two Ethiopian migrants are seriously burnt when their shop is set on fire by rioters. One of the victims later died of his wounds.
A statue of Queen Victoria is defaced. The act comes against a backdrop of vandalism against politically and culturally controversial monuments.
Residents of Ledig block the road with debris and demand that Disele Phologane, a director at Bakubung Community Development Unit, step down. Police clash with the demonstrators.
Land invaders riot and clash with police after their illegal shacks are destroyed by law enforcement.
EFF members protest by the statue of Paul Kruger and threaten to deface the statue again. One EFF members is arrested by police on-site. There are no reports of violence or destruction of property.
The Rhodes Memorial is defaced and burnt by unknown perpetrators. The vandalism has occurred amid a string of attacks against culturally significant monuments.
A Bangladeshi shopowner is killed by looters during ongoing xenophobic violence in Gauteng.
Demonstrators wearing ANC regalia deface a statue of Gandhi located opposite the ANCs party offices in Johannesburg.

On 12 April 2015, thousands of people took to the streets in an attempt to force out foreign nationals in the area. Several foreign-owned shops in KwaMashu (KwaZulu-Natal) were attacked. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities. [size=thousands]
Residents kill a man who admits to raping and murdering a local
Informal settlement residents petrol bomb and church and destroy local property. The riot is due to the residents recent eviction by law enforcement.

column9: SACTWU: Southern African Clothing and Textile Workers Union
column17: The Gauteng secretary of the South African Transport and Allied Workers Union is shot and killed by unknown assailants. The killing is believed to be related to competition between rival unions.
EFF members attempt a land grab in Ballito.
Local residents demonstrate over poor service delivery and the state of the roads by blocking streets with burning debris and throwing stones at passing motorists.

Protesting taxi operators block the road with burning tyres. The demonstrators say they are protesting against taxis from Wynberg, Retreat, Vrygrond and Khayelitsha that are wrongfully operating on the Westlake taxi route.

On 13 April 2015, thousands of people invaded and destroyed foreign-owned shops in Durban (KwaZulu-Natal). A group of demonstrators threw bottles and rocks at the police. Police used stun grenades to disperse the crowd. [size=thousands]

column16: Xenowatch; Mail & Guardian (South Africa); Institute for Security Studies
column17: On 13 April 2015, looting of foreign-owned shops was reported in Umlazi (KwaZulu-Natal). [size=no report]

Students at the University of Zululand march and hand over a memorandum of complaints including student funding problems, understaffed dining and lecture halls, lack of maintenance in residences, safety and security off campus, overcrowded lecture halls, poor service at various centres, a management vacuum and lack of student leadership.

EFF protesters demonstrate at the gates of the Khayelitsha Stadium and attempt to gain an audience with to the Deputy Minister of Police Maggie Sotyu. The demonstrators are the same group that land to invade and claim land in Khayelitsha the previous week.
Violence against immigrants by rioters spreads to Phoenix
Violence against immigrants by rioters spreads to Verulam
On 14 April 2015, police disperse rioters looting foreign-owned businesses and clashing with immigrants. [size=no report]
Students and parents opposing the appointment of two senior teachers riot and clash with police.
A Zimbabwean student is stabbed and seriously injured. The victim alleges that he was the victim of a xenophobic attacks but other witnesses dispute this.
Students at the University of Zululand riot and destroy property.
On 14 April 2015, foreign nationals were reportedly attacked in Durban CBD (KwaZulu-Natal). 75 people were arrested. [size=at least 75]
On 14 April 2015, a Somali national was shot and injured in a drive-by shooting in Durban CBD (KwaZulu-Natal). Attacks by a mob was registered during the day in the city (coded separately).
Students at the eThekwini Technical Vocational Education and Training (TVET) College protest about access to funding before being dispersed by police. No injuries reported.
Members of the Southern African Clothing and Textile Workers Union protest against City of Cape Towns decision to lease the Good Hope Centre in the central business district as a film studio.

Ledig residents riot and demand the release of community members who have been arrested for former incidences of public disorder. The demonstration was accompanied by the destruction of property and looting of foreign-owned shops.
A Malawian man is hacked to death and burnt during ongoing xenophobic violence in Durban.
On 15 April 2015, attackers in central Johannesburg throw bricks at the foreign store owners, who retaliate by throwing debris and missiles. [size=no report]
On or around 15 April 2015, violence against foreigners by rioters spreads to Eshowe. [size=no report]
On 15 April 2015, a group of about 20 South Africans looted foreign-owned shops and intimidated foreign shop owners. [size=about 20]
On 15 April 2015, xenophobic violence and the looting of foreign-owned properties results in three serious injuries. [size=no report]
A Zimbabwean man is killed by unknown assailants during ongoing xenophobic violence in Durban.
On 15 April 2015, a stand off between police and a group of South Africans trying to attack foreigners leads to the police dispersing the rioters with rubber bullets. [size=no report]
Students and parents opposing the appointment of two senior teachers protest and prevent classes from taking place
Wits University students march in solidarity with the victims of the Garissa attacks in Kenya

A wall built in remembrance of forced land removals in Kilnerton village, east of Pretoria,is defaced by unknown demonstrators. The vandalism has occurred amid a string of attacks against culturally significant monuments.
Two groups of rioters clash and petrol bomb vehicles. The reason for the altercation between the two groups is about awarding of tenders to build roads in the area.
A Zimbabwean woman is decapitated by an unknown gorup. The attack comes against a background of xenophobic violence.
Protesters demonstrate against xenophobia in the wake of a string of attacks on foreign nationals.

On 16 April 2015, police fired rubber bullets to disperse a group who was throwing stones at journalists in Actonville (Gauteng). The group was also demanding foreigners to leave the area. [size=no report]
On 16 April 2015, foreign-owned shops are targeted by rioters in Shakas Head. [size=no report]
On 16 April 2015, rioters and looters target foreign-owned businesses and property in central Johannesburg. [size=no report]
On 16 April 2015, a mob attacked foreign-owned shops and owners in Ekurheleni. A Ethiopian man is reportedly stabbed and injured during the violence. [size=no report]
A group disrupts a council meeting and protests against the proposed merger of Mbombela and Umjindi local municipalities.
On 16 April 2015, police use stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse rioters demonstrating against the presence of foreigners in Benoni. [size=no report]
Police clash with xenophobic rioters who launched a counter demonstration against anti-xenophobia protesters.

Students from the University of Cape Town protest against xenophobia outside parliament. The police attempt to disperse the demonstrators with stun grenades. There are no serious injuries or incidents of violence reported.
On 17 April 2015, foreign-owned shops are looted during ongoing xenophobic riots in Germiston. Several foreigners are injured after being attacked by locals. [size=no report]
On 17 April 2015, foreign-owned shops are looted during ongoing xenophobic riots in Ekurhuleni. [size=no report]

On 17 April 2015, xenophobic riots breakout in Cala after the body of a resident is found. The resident was dating a Zimbabwean national who is a suspect in her murder. Some foreign nationals defend their properties with guns. [size=no report]
On 17 April 2015, foreign-owned shops are raided in Pietermaritzburg by xenophobic rioters. [size=no report]
Police officers allegedly beat and torture a murder suspect to death. The police later round up three other suspects and shoot them in a field. The one of the three suspects survive.
The statue Umkhonto we Sizwe member Nokuthula Simelane is defaced. The vandalism has occurred amid a string of attacks against culturally significant monuments.

column16: Xenowatch; Institute for Security Studies; Xinhua
column17: On 17 April 2015, police dispersed rioters in central Johannesburg (Gauteng) during ongoing xenophobic attacks. Several foreign owned shops were looted. At least 10 people were arrested. [size=at least 10]
Residents and parents protest outside a school in Roodeport. The demonstrators allege fraudulent appointment of teachers and mismanagement of funds by the administration.
A Kenyan man is killed by unknown assailants during ongoing xenophobic violence in Gauteng.

Residents of Extension 24 in Middleberg took to the streets and burnt tyres. A man was killed, allegedly by a live bullet fired by the police which caught him in the stomach. The riot is related to racial tensions tied to competition between a coloured and a black taxi firm.
Two suspected looters are attacked and almost burnt to death by a crowd (the origin of the members of the crowd is not mentioned) before being rescued by police.
Ethiopian shopkeepers are stabbed during anti-migrant violence.

column9: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
column17: Amcu Rustenburg leader Collen Petlele isshot at his home by unknown assailants. His death closely followed that of SA Transport and Allied Workers Union (Satawu) Gauteng secretary Chris Nkosi.
On 18 April 2015, police use stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse rioters looting foreign-owned businesses in Alexandra. [size=no report]
On 18 April 2015, foreign-owned properties are set alight during anti-migrant riots in Illovo. [size=no report]
The Anglo Boer War statue in front of the East London City Hall is defaced by four unidentified men. The vandalism has occurred amid a string of attacks against culturally significant monuments.
On 18 April 2015, a Mozambican man was beaten and stabbed to death by four people in Alexandra, Johannesburg (Gauteng), during ongoing xenophobic violence in the region. [size=4]
Protesters wearing SACP shirts demonstrate outside the US embassy against US-imposed sanctions on Venezuela.
Residents destroy and burn the house of a traditional healer who they accuse of witchcraft.
Residents and DA members protested against failing infrastructure and poor service delivery in the City of Tshwane.
An EFF politician is shot and injured by unknown assailants while waiting for the arrival of Julius Malema who is due to give a speech in Alexandra township.

column7: PASMA: Pan Africanist Student Movement of Azania; Students (South Africa)
column17: Students from the Cape Peninsula University of Technologys branch of the Pan Africanist Student Movement of Azania march to parliament and protest against xenophobic violence.

500 people from Cala and surrounding areas marched to Cala Magistrates Court where a foreign national was appearing for the murder of his South African girlfriend. The demonstrators picketed outside the court with placards calling for no bail.
Residents barricaded roads and set fire to a municipal office during a service provision protest. Police clash with the protesters with tear gas.
Over 500 service delivery protesters barricade roads and stop residents and pupils from going to work or attending classes. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.
On 21 April 2015, a mob attack and injure foreigners attempting to re-open their businesses in Isipingo. [size=no report]
Workers at Good Hope Construction strike citing repeated violations of labour laws by the company. Property is reportedly damaged during the strike.
A Malawian man is pushed in front of a train and killed in Chatsworth. The motivation for the attack is believed to be xenophobia.
Taxi drivers riot after city officials block the road to taxi vehicles. Journalists are assaulted by the demonstrators and locals are injured.
Residents barricade the road in a protest against crime at stop-and-go points.
South African nationals and foreign nationals protest against ongoing xenophobic violence in Gauteng.
Construction workers riot and burn property after a rumour circulates that the workers will not be employed for the second phase of the contract.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League; ANC: African National Congress; SPRM: Seskhona Peoples Rights Movement
column17: A group representing a variety of organisations, including the ANC, ANCYL and Seskhona, march on Parliament to protest against xenophobia.
Residents of Haakdoring-laagte, also known as Ga-Moima Village, protest out side Pretoria High Court against an interdict to have them removed from the land they are occupying.
A Malawian is stabbed to death in a xenophobic attack. No large scale rioting is occurring during the attack.
Plettenburg Bay residents protest outside the trial of a suspect linked to an international child pornography network.
Pupils blockade the road as demand more teachers for understaffed schools in the area.
Residents of an informal settlement clash with police after trying to illegally occupy vacant land and erect shacks.
3000 people march against xenophobia at the Nelson Mandela Metropolitan University in Port Elizabeth. The march is organised by SASCO.
Several thousand demonstrators march through central Johannesburgy to protest against a spate of deadly attacks on immigrants.

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: Cosatu members marched in Pietermaritzburg to demand higher pay for public servants

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions
column17: 10000 Cosatu members marched through the centre of Pretoria to demand higher pay for public servants.
Paarl residents burn down ticket offices and stone vehicles during a service-delivery riot over electricity. The police a disperse the rioters.

EFF marches in Sunnyside to denounce xenophobic violence. They are joined by foreign nationals. The EFF announce that reason that the violence stems from frustrations over poverty, basic services and lack of jobs was because they had a government that had been teaching them the only way to resolve matters was through killing.
Ashton residents protest after a local farmer is killed. Demonstrators marched through the town and called for the arrest of the killer.
Thousands of people march against xenophobia in Pretoria following attacks on foreign nationals in Gauteng.
The Sarah Baartman memorial site is defaced with white paint by unknown demonstrators. The vandalism has occurred amid a string of attacks against culturally significant monuments.
Residents march against xenophobia.
Police clash with community members during a sweep in Rustenburg. Rioters threw stones at the police who responded with tear gas.
Ramotshere Moiloa mayor, Africa Thale, leads a march against xenophobia.

column7: TAC: Treatment Action Campaign; SJC: Social Justice Coalition; EE: Equal Education; EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters
column17: Residents and representatives of Equal Education, the Social Justice Coalition (SJC), Treatment Action Campaign (TAC) and the EFF take part in a protest against xenophobia.
Residents protest against xenophobic violence and march in solidarity with foreigners affected by the attacks.
On 27 April 2015, shops owned by Pakistani nationals were looted in Thabazimbi (Limpopo). No reason was reported. [size=no report]
Residents protest against alleged incidences of incompetence by the police.
On 28 April 2015, shops owned by Pakistani nationals were looted in Thabazimbi (Limpopo). 11 people were arrested. No reason was reported. [size=at least 11]
Protesters march staff off the premises of a Mfuleni school. The protesters want the provincial education department to replace the teachers with people from the area.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Police disperse a group of striking workers attempting to block a road at the Medupi power station near Lephalale. The striking workers are affiliated with NUMSA.
Residents of Lufhereng on the West Rand blockade the streets and intimidate motorists after a child was knocked down by a car and killed.
On 28 April 2015, community members engage in a gun battle with robbers in Krugersdorp. One robber is killed in the shootout while another is aprehended and handed over to the police.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: The more than 50 workers, mostly members of the South African Municipal Workers Union (Samwu), demonstrate outside an East London hotel in protest against the anticipated suspension of municipal manager Andile Fani.

Five Danisa family members were attacked and shot in Dunnhauser area near Newcastle whilst on their way to Johannesburg. Four of them were critically injured and one died at the scene. The attackers are believed to be from the Zulu family group. The Danisa and Zulu families are engaged in a dispute over the ownership of local land. Both families are based within the Msinga community.
A Somali shopkeeper is beaten by a crowd of community members and his shop is looted.

Residents barricade the road to prevent armed men from entering the area. The armed men are believed to be tied to the mining companies Xolco and Blue Bantry. The group fired shots at the residents. The residents were unarmed.
On 29 April 2015, foreign-owned shops were set on fire in Thabazimbi (Limpopo). No reason was reported. [size=no report]

An inaugeration ceremony at Stellenbosch University is disrupted by student protesters demanding effective transformation at the institution and the implementation of African languages as an academic language.
Members of the DA walk from central Joburg to Hillbrow to demonstrate against xenophobia and to support police efforts to curb it.

column7: SADTU: South African Democratic Teachers Union
column17: The South Africa Democratic Teachers Union launches a march outside the offices of the premier of Limpopo to demand higher wages.
A Somali shopkeeper is stabbed by unidentified assailants in a xenophobic attack.

Students at Stellenbosch University continue to protest against the lack of transformation at the university. One of the protesters demands is for the universities staff and student composition to be less white.
On 30 April 2015, hostel dwellers threw stones at the police and tried to loot foreign-owned shops in Actonville (Gauteng). No reason was reported. [size=no report]
Hillbrow organisations and local schools organise a silent march against xenophobia.
A Bangladeshi shopkeeper dies after his shop is petrol-bombed during a xenophobic attack
A group of disgruntled pupils the smash windows of buses in protest against the inadequate provision of transport

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Municipal workers affilliated with SAMWU march and protest over insufficient allowances and tools. The demonstrators riot and destroy property.

column7: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
column17: Rival union NUMSA also holds a march in Durban. There are no reports of violence between the two rallies.

column7: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions; SACP: South African Communist Party
column17: COSATU, supported by the SACP, heads a May Day rally in Durban.

Zulu family members are shot in their home in Muden resulting in one fatality. The attack is suspected to be carried out by the Danisa clan in revenge for a previous fatal attack carried out by the Zulu family on their family. Both families are based within the Msinga community.
Armed residents of Xolobeni clash with an armed group leading to multiple injuries. The dispute is tied to mining in the area by companies Xolco and Blue Bantry.
Two groups of student fight over scholar transport. One group accuses the other of driving away available transport with vandalism
Pupils barricade the roads with rocks in protest over the shortage of school transport.
Residents of Deipkloof hostel in Soweto riot over unfair allocation of hostel units. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.
Demonstrators protest outside the trial of a contract killer accused of murdering a teacher and demand that the accused is not granted bail.
Pro-mining groups allegedly beat up community members opposed to mining.
Residents of Eldorado Park in Soweto, illegally invade a piece of land in a bid and protest through the street demanding housing.
On 6 May 2015, residents barricaded roads with burning tires on the R36 highway near Sasekani (Limpopo) in a demonstration over water provision. [size=no report]

column7: Government of South Africa (1994-); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: Emergency services staff riot and burn two ambulances. The reason for the demonstration is unknown.
Pupils living in Tshidilamolomo attack bused-in pupils from Matloding with knives and clubs. The attackers accused the bused-in pupils of overcrowding their schools.
Soweto residents riot over the installation of pre-paid electricity metres. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

Ennerdale residents set tyres and bushes on fire in protest after police tear down shacks they had built on a piece of land they were occupying illegally. Police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

On 6 May 2015, three suspects of robbing a foreign owned shop were beaten by local residents in Sasekani (Limpopo). A foreign national was shot and injured during the robbery. One of the suspects assaulted by the mob died. 10 people were arrested. [size=at least 10]

column9: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Workers affiliated with SAMWU, armed with metal pipes and hockey sticks, march through Cape Town CBD to hand over a memorandum of 34 unresolved grievances. The SAMWU demonstrators loot goods from street vendors and clash with the police who disperse them with stun grenades.

Students protest against the suspension of the protester who started the anti-Rhodes protests for alleged racial abuse. The demonstrators argue that people associated with the Rhodes Must Fall campaign are being victimised by the university.
Students at the University of South Africa protest over accessibility to places of study, and the racial composition of exam invigilators.
Soweto residents riot over the installation of pre-paid electricity metres.
EFF members protest outside the head offices of Big Bucks and express solidarity with its striking employees.

Approximately 50 protesters demonstrate outside Johannesburg police station where an unknown number of foreign nationals are being held. The foreign nationals have been detained as part of a government-led crackdown on migrant crime and undocumented migrants. The protesters sang struggle songs and held up placards banners and placards saying ""Release our Brothers and Sisters"" and ""SAPS Xenophobia"".

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress
column17: The Mamahule community, occupy land next to the luxurious Mall of the North in Polokwane, and accuse police of favouring another community on the land. The demonstrators chant slogans and hand over a memorandum to police demanding ""fair treatment"". The protesters are wearing EFF and ANC T-shirts.
Thousands marched through the Cape Town CBD asking for the decriminalisation of marijuana for adult use
A man is bludgeoned to death in a suspected vigilante attack.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: About 300 Gauteng Department of Social Development employees marched under public service union Nehawu in the Joburg CBD. The demonstrators were calling for the dismissal of two officials, one of whom is accused of sexual harassment and intimidation. The demonstrators also protest over nepotism, wage disputes and intimidation.
Skyforce General Services employees picketed outside the Cape Town civic centre and demand to speak to Mayor Patricia de Lille about outstanding salaries.
Residents of Atok in the Sekhukhune platinum region block the roads with burning debris and demand the mining company reveal how community equitable shares are utilised.

Police clash with rioters in Atok. The rioters are demanding employment at a local mine and that the mining company adhere to its promises to help develop the local community. During the clashes a rioter is fatally shot by police.
Protesters demonstrating over service delivery set fire to a local councillors house and vandalise local schools.
Contruction workers block the road with burning debris to protest against their victimisation by local taxi drivers who demand to be included in the construction contracts.

Roodepan residents destroy a Bangladeshi-owned shop after rumours circulate that the shop owners attack a local youth who accused them of giving incorrect change. The police protect the shop owners but do not engage with the rioters.
Senior citizens march to Parliament demanding that their monthly pension grants be doubled.
Police clash with rioters in Bedford. During the riot the police fatally shoot a rioter. The reason for the riot is unknown.
Parents, pupils and teachers protested outside a school in Port Elizabeth, carrying placards, pleading with the education department to provide more teachers.

Students demanding the use of non-Afrikaans languages by the the faculty at Stellenboch University protest outside the administration building. The students protest against the universities vice-rector who has dismissed their demands.
Bedford residents gathered outside the Adelaide Magistrates Court to show support for three men arrested for a violent service delivery protest on Tuesday.

Disgruntled residents from Rolihlahla informal settlement, protesting about poor service delivery, block the main road to Uitenhage, Eastern Cape, with burning tyres. Police were called to control the situation.

column7: ANC: African National Congress; SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: ANC members protest outside Calata House and accuse branch and regional leaders of rigging their membership status to influence the outcomes of branch general meetings.
Atok residents continue to riot and clash with police. The demonstrators are demanding jobs at Bokoni Platinum Mine and investment from the parent company.
Protesters in Ekurhuleni continue to protest against poor service provision. No reports of violence or damage to property.
Folweni residents stage a service delivery protest. There are reports of demonstrators blocking roads and burning debris.
Community members protest against bail for a man accused of rape and murder. Demonstrators protest outside the court where the man is standing trial.
Approximately 100 Walter Sisulu University (WSU) students march to the local home affairs department and protest against xenophobia.
Taxi drivers in dispute with the taxi association board over the issuing of operating licenses block the roads and pelt cars with stones.

Striking workers affiliated with NUM strike outside the offices of Good Hope Construction. Private security armed with pangas, allegedly gang members hired by the company, kill one of the striking workers.
Over 100 municipal workers engage in a silent protest during the inaugeration of the new provincial Eastern Cape director-general.

column7: ANC: African National Congress; SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: Soweto residents, wearing ANC regalia and led by SANCO march against Eskom after Soweto suffers power cuts. The demonstrators argue that Eskom purposefully caused the blackout in retaliation for riots against prepaid water metres. Some demonstrators erect barricades during the protest.
A former Nelson Mandela Bay safety and security councillor, Thembinkosi Mafana, is held hostage by angry Wells Estate residents protesting against poor service derlivery.
Protesters demanding the Marikana report storm a dinner where Deputy President Cyril Ramphosa was speaking. The protesters shouted that Ramphosa is a killer.
Residents of Fisantekraal informal settlement protest to support 10 residents on trial for melicious damage to property.
Pupils beat a group of unidentified robbers to death. The robbers had been mugging students before a crowd of pupils beat the criminals to death in a vigilante attack.
People protest against North West Premier Supra Mahumapelo and accuse him of corruption in tender allocations.
Police investigating a murder shoot a fleeing youth in the back.
Community members clash with police and burn police vehicles after an officer shoots an unarmed local youth.

The house of a relative of former councillor Thembinkosi Mafana is set alight. Mafana blames the EFF but the claims have not yet been proven. Mafan was held hostage by irate residents protesting over poor service delivery the day before the arson attack.
Youth violently disrupt the handing over of RDP houses to pensioners.
Provincial DA leader James Masango leads a protest and demands that the Govan Mbeki local municipality reach an agreement with Eskom to prevent power cuts in the area

Stellenbosch shack fire survivors protest against the involvement of the ANC dominated Kayamandi Development Forum (KDF) in their new government housing development project and hand a memorandum of their grievances to the Stellenbosch Executive Mayor.
Taxi drivers set fire to the vehicles of a rival taxi firm. The riot is due to alleged racial discrimination and insults by coloured taxi drivers against their black counterparts.
Taxi drivers use their vehicles to barricade the road in a protest against the introduction of the Rea Kgona high frequency bus service, which they believe will put them out of business.
Residents set several government offices on fire after a resident is arrested on suspicion of murder by police. The residents claim the suspect is innocent.

On 18 May 2015, community members raided foreign-owned shops in Petrus Steyn (Free State). The riot allegedly occurred after an altercation at a nearby shop owned by a local woman and a foreign national. 11 people were arrested. [size=at least 11]
Police attempt to evict squatters in an informal settlement. Armed squatters throw stones at police and destroy local property.
100 members of the Cape Flats Concerned Residents Association march to Parliament to protest against gang violence in their neighbourhood.

A man is assassinated by unknown assailants on Tuesday 19/05/2015 outside Umlazi magistrates court. The killing is linked to ongoing violence in Glebelands Hostel in Umlazi. The violence is simultaneously tied to discrepancies and corruption in the allocation of beds and the political conflict between mayor James Nxumalo and councillor Zandile Gumede.

Nursing students protest over the lack of class space and destroy university property at King Sabata Dalindyebo Technical Vocational Education and Training College. There are no reports of direct involvement by the police but some of the rioters are later arrested.

column7: SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: Residents of Cofimbaba and Tsomo riot, destroy property and clash with police. The demonstrators, led by SANCO, are accusing the municipal manager, Zamuxolo Shasha, of employing family members and friends to administrative positions in the municipality. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

column7: SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: Residents of Cofimbaba and Tsomo riot, destroy property and clash with police. The demonstrators, led by SANCO, are accusing the municipal manager, Zamuxolo Shasha, of employing family members and friends to administrative positions in the municipality. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.
Residents and community members burn the house of Methodist priest Samuel Ndadza after he admits to being a witch.
Police attempt to evict squatters in Moeggesukkel informal settlement on the outskirts of Uitenhage leading to clashes between the two sides.
Residents and religious leaders march to the local police station in a bid to protest against the bail proceedings of a murder suspect.
Missionvale residents throw buckets of faeces onto the old Uitenhage road during a protest against slow delivery of RDP houses.
MTN workers initiate a strike and protest outside the companies head offices demanding a 10 percent salary increase, the conversion of temporary staff to permanent and 16 percent bonus payments.

About 400 reservists from four provinces - Gauteng, Limpopo Free State and Mpumalanga - take to the streets, claiming that police management have reneged on a promise to integrate them into the police service.
Rioters protesting over the allocation of RDP houses burn tyres and throw stones at police officers on the scene. The police in turn fire rubber bullets and throw stun grenades at the crowd.
Students riot and hold staff captive during a protest over shortfalls in the National Student Financial Aid Scheme at the Braemar campus of Costal KwaZulu-Natal TVET College.
The wives of jobless miners at the now-defunct Blyvooruitzicht Mine protest against the lack of water at their residences.
Students clash with police during protest over shortfalls in the National Student Financial Aid Scheme at the Moben campus of Costal KwaZulu-Natal TVET College.
Students protest over shortfalls in the National Student Financial Aid Scheme at the Umbumbulu campus of Costal KwaZulu-Natal TVET College.

A second man is assassinated by unknown assailants a second consecutive day of killings on Wednesday. This is the second killing linked to ongoing violence in Glebelands Hostel in Umlazi in a week after an assination on Tuesday. The violence is simultaneously tied to discrepancies and corruption in the allocation of beds and the political conflict between mayor James Nxumalo and councillor Zandile Gumede.
Students damage and burn university property during protest over shortfalls in the National Student Financial Aid Scheme at the Durban campus of Costal KwaZulu-Natal TVET College.
Students damage and burn university property during protest over shortfalls in the National Student Financial Aid Scheme at the Umlazi campus of Costal KwaZulu-Natal TVET College.

column7: SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: Residents of Cofimbaba and Tsomo riot, destroy property and clash with police. The demonstrators, led by SANCO, are accusing the municipal manager, Zamuxolo Shasha, of employing family members and friends to administrative positions in the municipality. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

column7: SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
column17: Residents of Cofimbaba and Tsomo riot, destroy property and clash with police. The demonstrators, led by SANCO, are accusing the municipal manager, Zamuxolo Shasha, of employing family members and friends to administrative positions in the municipality. The police disperse the rioters with rubber bullets.

Nursing students at King Sabata Dalindyebo Technical Vocational Education and Training College protest outside Libode court where 19 students are to stand trial on charges of melicious property damage and vandalism.
Residents destroy water pipes that go through their village without irrigating the area. The residents protest that it is unfair that they have no access to water.
Approximately 200 pupils from Maitland High School protested outside the offices of the Western Cape Education Department over the shortage of textbooks at their school.
Emergency services staff riot and stone vehicles transporting patients. The reason for the demonstration is unknown.
Emergency services staff riot and burn an ambulence. The reason for the demonstration is unknown.
A DA Youth leader, led about 250 students on a march to deliver a memorandum calling for improvement in shuttle services.

A third man is assassinated by unknown assailants in a third consecutive day of killings on Friday. This is the third killing linked to ongoing violence in Glebelands Hostel in Umlazi in a week after an assination on Tuesday and Wednesday. The violence is simultaneously tied to discrepancies and corruption in the allocation of beds and the political conflict between mayor James Nxumalo and councillor Zandile Gumede.

Residents burn tyres and barricade the road near Anglo Platinum's Twickenham mine. The residents accuse the mine of negligence in relocating community graves during their operations and for not considering local residents for job opportunities.
A man is severely beaten by community members accused of killing residents after two headless bodies are found in the area..
Over 200 people in Port Elizabeth take part in a global march against international biotechnology company Monsanto
Over 100 activists protest against the use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) by multinational agrochemical group Monsanto.
Activists protest against genetically modified crops and pesticides.
Activists protest against genetically modified crops and pesticides.
An ANC councillor of the Govan Mbeki Municipality is in a critical condition after being shot during a council meeting.
Two ANC factions violently clash after one group is forcible barred from where the branch annual general meeting is taking place.
Residents of Mdantsane burn tyres outside the home of ward councillor Nomalizo Makapela-Pakade, calling for her to step down. The riot is related to service derlivery.
Residents drain a reservoir during a protest over lack of access to water. The villgers also chase away officials sent to fix the reservoir.
Protesters barricade Sheffield and Govan Mbeki roads and the N2 with stones, burning tyres and rubbish to protest against a lack of basic services in the Marikana informal settlement.
Taxi operators blockade roads, burn bins and stone buses and vehicles in the Durban CBD during a protest over the councils decision to impound their taxis.
An unknown group blow up a tender box containing bids for prospective contractors in Polokwane. The perpetrators left the scene before the explosion destroyed the tenders.

column7: Government of South Africa (1994-); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: Emergency Medical Services (EMS) members protest at the Durban Magistrates Court demanding that their leader, Sifiso Eric Dlamini, is released. Dlaminis arrest came after numerous adverse incidents related to EMS, including the stoning of a Planned Patient Transport vehicle and the burning of two ambulances in Uthungulu district.
Residents of KwaLink Village picket outside the Mthatha Magistrates Court, opposing bail for three suspects accused of kidnapping and murdering a young couple.

On 27 May 2015, rioters loot shops after a man is stabbed to death by a group for stealing from a foreign-owned shop. It is unknown whether the looters specifically targeted foreign-owned shops or whether the vigilantes who killed the alleged thief are foreign-born. [size=no report]

Residents of Marikana informal settlement protest for a second day over water, sanitation and poor service derliver. The demonstrators block the road with burning debris before being dispersed by the police with rubber bullets. A ward councillors house is burnt down by the rioters.
Two DASO students are attacked by unknown individuals at the University of Fort Hares Alice campus. The attack is suspected to be due to the victims political affiliation.
About 150 members of the Social Justice Coalition march to the civic centre and demanded ""a detailed account"" of hundreds of submissions to the City of Cape Town on the 2015/16 budget.
Students at Wits University hold a sit-in to demand the institution secure employment for electrical workers who lost their jobs earlier this year.
Students at Umfolozi training college riot demand accommodation and transport allowances. The demonstrators destroy university property and clash with police.
Demonstrators march in protest of violence against women. The march happened at the memorial service of Nolukholo Xasa who was recently murdered by a local man.

Residents of Marikana informal settlement protest for a third day over water, sanitation and poor service derliver. The demonstrators block the road with burning debris before being dispersed by the police with rubber bullets.
A man dies after his car is hit with bricks during a service derlivery riot in Marikana informal settlement.
DA members protest outside the Sammy Marks Council Chamber to protest in solidarity with a DA councillor who claims that executive mayor Kgosientso Ramokgopa made sexist comments to her.

column7: DA: Democratic Alliance; ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League
column17: DA members protest outside a council meeting in which ANC incumbent Jordaan is re-elected. The DA had boycotted the meeting.

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union
column17: Thousands of unionised workers affiliated with SATAWU at the Passenger Rail Agency of SA march in Pretoria and demand the immediate dissolution of the agencies board.

Residents of Marikana informal settlement riot and destroy houses near the settlement. The act prompts retaliation by residents of Lower Crossroads who, in turn, set ablaze a shack of the man they accused of being behind the attacks. Service-derlivery have been ongoing in the Marikana informal settlement area.

Striking workers, supported by the CWU, barricade the entrance to MTNs head office and burn debris. The workers are striking over neglect and alleged racial abuse by management. The rioters clash with police who use tear gas and rubber bullets.

Residents of Clairwood in Durban burn debris and barricade the road to prevent trucks from gaining entry to the area. The residents complain that the trucks have caused extensive damage to properties in the area.
Childrens rights activists protest outside the George Magistrates Court where a prominent local dentist appeared in connection with the alleged sexual assault of a 12-year-old boy.

Three people die in clashes between the residents of Marikana Informal Settlement and Lower Crossroads. The clashes started during a service-delivery riot by Marinkana residents, who allegedly targeted the homes of Lower Crossroads residents who opposed the demonstrations.
EFF members gather to hold a night vigil ahead of party leader Julius Malemas appearance in the Pretoria High Court on charges relating to tax irregularities.

column7: SWEAT: Sex Workers Education and Advocacy Taskforce
column17: Sex workers and sex worker-rights activists protest outside the trial of prominent artist Zwelethu Mthethwa, who is on trial for the murder of a sex worker in 2013.

Pupils burn their school to the ground during a protest. The pupils were protesting about the school buildings that needed renovations, saying that their concerns were being neglected and ignored by the education authorities.
North West University students and staff march in Mahikeng against xenophobia.

Hundreds of EFF supporters demonstrate outside Pretoria High Court where Julius Malema is on trial for tax irregularities. There are reports of EFF members engaging in muggings, extortion and sexual harassment during the protest.

column7: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
column17: Members of NEHAWU march to the Pretoria offices of the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries protesting against pay scales which are allegedly tied to skin colour and disadvantage black workers.

column9: ANC: African National Congress; Teachers (South Africa)
column17: Vusi Ntombela, a teacher, ANC member and Speaker of the Nquthu local municipality, is shot dead by unknown assailants in his classroom. A child injured in the shooting later dies.

Students at Lindelani Senior Secondary School riot and destroy property in a protest against the removal of a popular teacher. The police disperse the rioters resulting in a student suffering a bullet wound to the head. The student is currently in a coma.

A group of 70 people in Durban march against the influx of foreigners to South Africa. They disperse after being told by the police that their march is illegal and hand a memorandum to the police to pass on to the city manager.

A group of Fisantekraal occupants halted the construction of a new suburb and assault members of the community who were in favour of the development. The rioters had not applied for the Government subsidies that would enable them qualify as beneficiaries from the project.
Residents of KwaMakutha township riot and stone police in a demonstration over service delivery and ward boundaries.

Students at Umfolozi training college riot and destroy property after they are unable to access grants owed to them by the National Student Financial Aid Scheme. Many students have had their grants witheld due to insufficient funds within the scheme.

Lwandle residents evicted last year from SANRAL-owned lands protest and demand that the authorities pay attention to their problems. Some demonstrators vandalise property and burn debris. The police non-violently disperse the demonstration.

column16: South African Police Service; Pretoria News
column17: Police reservists demonstrate demanding to be integrated into full time positions. Some protesters throw stones during the demonstration. The police are called in to disperse the rioters.
Car wash owners and residents protest against the City of Tshwanes plan to revitalise the townships economy by building a multi-million car wash in the community.
Police reservists continue to protest and demand integration into full time positions. No reports of violence.

column6: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column9: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: People present at the ANCYL elective congress in KwaZulu-Natal are threatened and physically assaulted by other members.

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: Police fire rubber bullets at ANCYL members barred from the KwaZulu-Natal elective congress who attempt to force their way into the meeting.
Residents of Dube Hostel in Soweto riot and loot after the hostel suffers electricity blackouts. Soweto residents clash and fight with rioters from the hostel in an effort to protect their property.
Three youths accused of thievery are necklaced by community members.
Residents from the Entuze Reserve near KwaDlangezwa blocked the road during a protest over the condition of rural roads.
Members of the Hout Bay community hold a vigil to protest against crime in the area after a Congolese man is killed in a robbery.

column7: DA: Democratic Alliance; ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League; Women (South Africa)
column17: Community members protest against bail for a man accused of murdering three local girls. The protest was organised by the ANCWL and attended by DA members.
Students at the University of South Africa riot after being barred from completing their exams due to lateness.
A vigilante mob attack three men accused of robbing train passengers. All three victims are rushed to hospital where one dies of his injuries.

Six men are seriously assaulted by residents after they are accused of involvement in a string of crimes in the area. The six suspects are then handed over to police by the community. One of the suspects dies in police custody. There is no evidence that the man died from wounds sustained while in police custody.
Worshippers at Unity Fellowship Church march through central Johannesburg to protest against harassment by the police.
Demonstrators protest in Witbank against the monopolisation of business by regional premier David Mabuza. The protesters are dispersed by police with rubber bullets. No injuries reported.
Activists protest and call for criminal charges against community health-care workers in the Free State to be dropped, and for Free State Health MEC Benny Malakoane to be dismissed.
A man suspected of murder is assaulted by residents after the body of a dismembered pupil is found in the local area.

Durban's Lindelani township stage a protest over a lack of housing and speed humps. During the protest rioeters blockaded roads with boulders and burning tyres and surrounded the house of the local councillor and destroy the councillors water metre.
Residents of Harrismith set a clinic on fire during a service delivery protest.
Over 100 housing contractors protest demanding R31- million they say is owed to them by the local authorities. The demonstrators block roads with their vehicles.

Unidentified assailants fire shots at workers travelling to work at Medupi power plant, injuring two workers. Workers at the plant recently engaged in a strike. Workers returned to work after a court order demanded an end to the strike. However, some workers, supported by NUMSA, have continued to strike illegally.

Workers of Lonmin mine in Brits are joined by the community of the nearby villages to protest against Lonmin in an attempt to block an anticipated retrenchment of some of the workers. The demonstrators also demanded a change of the contracted bus service transporting mine workers. The protesters burn tyres and erect barricades on the road.

Workers of Lonmin mine in Brits are joined by the community of the nearby villages to protest against Lonmin in an attempt to block an anticipated retrenchment of some of the workers. The demonstrators also demanded a change of the contracted bus service transporting mine workers. The protesters burn tyres and erect barricades on the road.

Workers of Lonmin mine in Brits are joined by the community of the nearby villages to protest against Lonmin in an attempt to block an anticipated retrenchment of some of the workers. The demonstrators also demanded a change of the contracted bus service transporting mine workers. The protesters burn tyres and erect barricades on the road.
The car of a non-striking worker at MTN is petrol-bombed. Workers affiliated with the CWU, who are leading the strike at MTN, are suspected to have perpetrated the arson attack. No reported injuries.
Students at Buffalo City College protest over transport allowances. The demonstrators throw stones at police who respond with stun grenades and teargas.

Workers of Lonmin mine in Brits are joined by the community of the nearby villages to protest against Lonmin in an attempt to block an anticipated retrenchment of some of the workers. The demonstrators also demanded a change of the contracted bus service transporting mine workers. The protesters burn tyres and erect barricades on the road.
Children and teachers from 40 creches around Mdantsane march to the central police station to speak out against child abuse.

Lonmin workers and residents protest in and around Majakaneng demanding 500 jobs from Lonmin andthreatening to scrap the companies licence to operate on their land should the jobs not materialise. During the protest Lonmin trucks and property is burnt by the demonstrators.
Residents block the road. The residents complain that municipal toilets have not been emptied by the council.

column7: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress
column17: The inaugeral Free State Youth Parliament was disrupted by a protest allegedly carried out by the EFF and ANC youth structures.
Residents of an informal settlement protest over the failure of the local government to fulfill their promise of demarcating an area where they can build homes.

Residents of villages under the Bapo Ba Mogale Tribal Authority riot and burn Lonmin property. Lonmin and the council had previously signed a R660-million equity deal that promised major economic development and job creation for the community. But downsizing at Lonmin has prevented the promises from being met.
Hlalani residents barricade the road and threaten to make Grahamstown ungovernable unless their demands for decent housing are met.
The SACP lead a demonstration outside the American consulate as part of the Hands of Venezuela campaign which protests against alleged American aggression against Venezuela.
A member of the IFP's ward committee is killed in KwaMashu by unknown assailants.
Hlalani residents barricade roads with burning debris for the second time in a week during a protest over housing.
1000 demonstrators associated with the SACP march to the American consulate in Sandton to protest against American interference in Venezuela.

A land dispute between the Danisa and Zulu families, both of which have their roots within the Msinga community, results in armed clashes and killings in Msinga and various hostels in Gauteng (Four fatalities divided between two events).

A land dispute between the Danisa and Zulu families, both of which have their roots within the Msinga community, results in armed clashes and killings in Msinga and various hostels in Gauteng (Four fatalities divided between two events).
Residents barricade the road in a protest over the lack of roads, insufficient electricity and poor service delivery.
Two men accused of stabbing a 32-year-old man to death at a local tavern are stoned to death by community members.

Police use rubber bullets on Matloding villagers trying to renovate a dilapidated school. Pupils from the village have had to be schooled in nearby areas but have faced attacks and abuse. The villagers were allegedly given permission by the provincial education department to renovate the school before they were set upon by the police.
Sex workers protest outside the ongoing trial of prominent artist Zwelethu Mthethwa, who is on trial for the murder of a sex worker in 2013.
Students in Rondebosch march against xenophobia during Youth Day.

Hlalani residents barricade the road in protest during a question and answer session with the mayor. The demonstrators accuse the mayor and ward councillors of failing to provide them with adequate housing.
Rioters protesting over the lack of electricity supply dig trenches to bar access to Siphethu hospital.
Residents of Kliptown block the road with burning tyres and debris in protest against evictions and what they claim to be exorbitant municipal levies.

Education officials investigating matric exam cheating in KwaZulu-Natal are targeted during violent protests by pupils. Proptery is destroyed and officials were locked inside the venues where the hearings were held. The protests take place in Umgungundlovu and Ilembe district.

Education officials investigating matric exam cheating in KwaZulu-Natal are targeted during violent protests by pupils. Proptery is destroyed and officials were locked inside the venues where the hearings were held. The protests take place in Umgungundlovu and Ilembe district.
Rioters protesting over the lack of electricity bar access to Siphethu hospital for a second day. The police are called in to disperse the rioters.

Police use teargas and rubber bullets to prevent a group of about 50 residents from Barcelona informal settlement from dumping buckets full of human waste onto the N2 highway. Residents said their buckets have not been collected or cleaned for the past four months.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: SAMWU-affiliated workers are pepper-sprayed by private security guards after attempting to force their way into to the council chamber to discuss their grievances including pay owed to 14 Uitenhage and Despatch workers.
On 18 June 2015, a jogging youth is stabbed to death by community members in Mandalay when he is mistakenly identified as a thief.
Ventersdorp hospital workers in North West picket outside the hospital, opposing the decision to downgrade the facility to a health centre.
400 Knysna residents barricade the road with burning tyres during a service derlivery. They are dispersed by police with runnber bullets.

Parents chase teachers from a school in Roodepoort and try to petrol bomb the home of a former school governing body member. The rioters demand that their children are taught only by coloured, rather than black, teachers. The police intervene.
On 20 June 2015, foreign-owned shops are destroyed and looted by community members after a local man is stabbed by a Somali national during an arugment. [size=no report]
Residents of Mfuleni Garden City informal settlement demolish the shacks of three Seskhona leaders, accusing them of selling land plots.
Protesters barricade the road to Madwaleni hospital with rocks and burning tyres during a service delivery protest. Police disperse the rioters with stun grenades and rubber bullets.
Uitenhage residents protest against ANC councillor Monde Vaaltyn who they accuse of nepotism in the allocation of community development projects.
Students protest outside the trial of three Stutterheim teachers arrested for allegedly stealing food meant for pupils. The protesters demand that the teachers not be granted bail.
Demonstrators form a human chain to protest against gangsterism in the area.

Youths blockade a main road in Pienaar near Mbombela with burning tree trunks, tyres and rocks to protest against Ward 24 councillor Thembi Lillian Dludlu who is accused of only contracting ANC members to perform municipal construction jobs.
A woman from Limpopo has been protesting outside the Parliamentary precinct about issues concerning government. The protester has not yet submitted any formal petition to Parliament.
Residents of Tlhabane in Rustenburg riot against the lack of service delivery and shortage of water in the area. Residents allegedly damaged traffic lights and pelted passing cars with stones.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Inkwanca municipal workers block roads with burning debris and demand the payment of nine months of outstanding wages. The demonstrators are allegedly affiliated with South African Municipal Workers Union.
Protesters barricade the road to Madwaleni hospital with rocks and burning tyres during a service delivery protest for a second day. Police disperse the rioters with stun grenades and rubber bullets.

A broad spectrum of residents, community organisations, students movements, religious groups, people with disability and members of the public protest against the 25.3% electricity tariff hike that has been proposed by Eskom.

Student members of the ANC and EFF, armed with sticks, clash ahead of a visit by Zuma to the Tshwane University of Technology. The ANC members allegedly barred the EFF access to the meeting sparking a fight between the two groups.
Burn victims assemble outside the Department of Home Affairs head offices in Pretoria demanding to speak to senior officials over alleged discrimination against them.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Inkwanca municipal workers riot for a second day and demand the payment of nine months of outstanding wages. The demonstrators are allegedly affiliated with South African Municipal Workers Union.

The police allegedly disrupt a peaceful protest by the CWU outside the head offices of MTN, a company currently engaged in an industrial dispute with the CWU. The police use rubber bullets and stun grenades resulting in serious injuries.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
column17: Inkwanca municipal workers riot for a third day and demand the payment of nine months of outstanding wages. The demonstrators are allegedly affiliated with South African Municipal Workers Union.

Hundreds of residents from Tsunami informal settlement in Delft march to the provincial legislature and hand over a memorandum of grievances to MEC for Human Settlement Bonginkosi Madikizela. Grievances include the standard of housing and the provision of electricity.
Residents of Clairwood in Durban protest against a development project in the area which will increase congestion.
50 traffic officers protest to demand additional allowances they claim are owed to them for performing additional duties.
Diepkloof residents in Soweto protest against power cuts in their area. The protesters block roads and pelt passing vehicles with stones.
CWU strikers attack MTNs Midrand offices, assault and pour petrol on staff. The petrol is not ignited. Workers at MTN affiliated with the CWU have been on strike for five weeks.
Community members severely beat a man accused of fatally shooting a child. The man is taken into custody before he is killed.
A man is shot and injured in Glebelands Hostel. The root of the conflict is allegedly due to competition between different block committees at the hostel.

Christians march against a proposal by the government to end Easter and Christmas as public holidays. The current system in which Christian holidays are automatically deemed holidays while members of other religions have to request time off is deemed discriminatory and thus unconstitutional.
Community members at Riba Cross burn and loot a liquor store after a resident dies at the establishment in mysterious circumstances.
Residents in Ditsobotla municipality protest against the illegal occupation of low cost houses by squatters.
Mdantsane residents protest and burn debris after being left without electricity or water for a week.

Taxi drivers protest over the introduction of subsidised bus services by Autopax which they claim will deprive them of customers. The taxi drivers hassle commuters and try to dissuade them from using the service.
LGBT students at Univeristy of Cape Town protest after a leader in the UCT SRC posts comments denouncing the US Supreme Courts decision concerning same-sex marriage.

column7: SAFCEI: Southern African Faith Communities Environment Initiative
column17: An interfaith group protest against nuclear energy outside Parliament in a demonstration led by the Southern African Faith Communities Environment Institute.
Residents of Wells Estate in Port Elizabeth petrol bomb municipal vehicles during a service delivery protest. The Public Order Policing unit are deployed to the scene.

Residents of Lerato Park in Kimberly demonstrate in front of regional Premier Sylvia Lucas over the allocation of new houses after the deadline for the release of the list of beneficiaries passed without any information being released. The rioters burn tyres and jostle with police.
Strike action against South Africa's second-biggest mobile network MTN continues as Communication Workers Union members protested outside MTNs Fairland office.

Taxi drivers barricade the Autopax depot to prevent Autopax buses from leaving. The demonstrators demand that taxi associations be given the Mamelodi route instead of the Autopax buses argue that the subsidised bus service will cost them business.
Protesters demonstrate against the live-export of animals for slaughter. The protest takes place during the loading of 3000 live animals for export to Mauritius.
Residents of Modderspruit barricade the road and protest that the nearby mines have not kept to their promises of providing employment for locals.
Taxi drivers in Mamelodi stone Autopax vehicles to protest against the introduction of a subsidised bus service.

Taxi drivers barricade the Autopax depot for a second day to prevent Autopax buses from leaving. The demonstrators demand that taxi associations be given the Mamelodi route instead of the Autopax buses argue that the subsidised bus service will cost them business.

Protesters from Lesotho protest outside the offices of the Department of International Relations and Cooperation and demand that the government prioritise stabilising the political situation within Lesotho.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a second day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Taxi drivers pelt Autopax vehicles with stones. The rioters oppose the introduction of subsidised Autopax buses which they say will deprive taxi drivers of business.
Taxi drivers opposing the introduction of new bus routes in the area by Autopax fire shots at Autopax vehicles. A woman was severely injured during the shooting.
Mamelodi commuters angrily protest to Tshwane Mayor Kgosientso Ramokgopa about ongoing obstructions caused by taxi operations opposing the imposition of new bus routs.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a third day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Activists protest outside a circus over its use of animals during shows.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a fourth day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
An ANC meeting to elect new leaders for the Eastern Capes Mbizana sub-region leads to a clash in which the two factions throw bricks and stones at each other.
Hundreds of people in Melmoth peacefully protest in the streets, opposing bail for three murder suspects.

Protesters picket the Lilian Ngoyi Memorial Centres construction project and threaten to halt construction after 18 undocumented foreign nationals working on the project are arrested by police. The protesters are calling for more arrests as they claim that there are more than 18 undocumented foreign workers working on the project.
Dunoon residents march and demand that empty mobile classrooms be put to use as a new primary school for their children to attend.
Residents of Majakaneng riot over the lack of employment opportunities for locals at a nearby mine. The demonstrators barricade roads and burn vehicles.

A dispute between two villages, Khuleka and Masemeni, over the distribution of jobs in Libode and a project to build a psychiatric ward and doctors quarters at St Barnabas Hospital result in a clash between residents of each village. Two men, a ward councillor and a community member, sustain gunshot wounds.
Two men accused of stealing a cellphone in Heideveldis ambushed by a crowd and set on fire.
Residents of Khayelitsha protest and demand that tavern owners stop selling alcohol to underage girls.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a fith day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Residents of Mooinooi burn debris and pelt cars with stones. The protest comes after the community complained that the local mines do not employ them.
Two men accused of being behind a spate of robberies are stoned to death by community members.
